title: Over 200 Lankans employed as nurses in Israel
author: Author not found
Content: The number of Sri Lankans sent to Israel, to work as nurses, has exceeded two hundred this year (2023). Yesterday (31 July), at the Ministry of Labour and Foreign Employment, the awarding of flight tickets to 15 more Sri Lankans, who received nursing work mandates in Israel, was conducted under the patronage of the Minister of Labour and Foreign Employment Manusha Nanayakkara. This group marks the 69th batch of workers to secure jobs in Israel and they are scheduled to depart for Israel on 2 August. Remarkably, in the first six months of this year alone, 202 Sri Lankans have been granted job mandates in the field of nursing services in Israel. As per the Memorandum of Understanding (MoU) between the Governments of Israel and Sri Lanka, nursing jobs in Israel are exclusively available to Sri Lankans through the Sri Lanka Bureau of Foreign Employment (SLBFE). The Ministry of Labour and Foreign Employment urged the public to refrain from engaging with individuals outside of the SLBFE or giving money and passports to obtain jobs in Israel.

title: Seven men, one woman arrested over cigarette theft
author: Author not found
Content: Biyagama Police on 30 July found a stock of cigarettes, valued at around one million rupees. The cigarettes had been sold to six shops in the Doramadalawa area of Anuradhapura. The cigarettes were part of a larger stock valued at nearly Rs 1.2 million which had been stolen from a three-wheeler, which distributed cigarettes to shops. During the operation, Police also seized Rs 40,000 obtained from the sale of stolen cigarettes. The three men from Grandpass were also found in possession of six gms of heroin. It is suspected that they were planning to sell it in Biyagama. They had at this time spotted the parked three-wheeler carrying the cigarettes, decided to rob it and make good their escape. Police apprehended the suspects following a complaint about the cigarette theft. Police Inspector S. D. Garusingha, intelligence officers from the Police Special Task Force with the help of CCTV footage were able to arrest the suspects. The stolen cigarettes were handed over to the three men from Grandpass and then given to the woman to sell. However, she had handed the stock to a man in Doramadalawa for distribution. The suspects were aged from 38 to 50. BY K. Duminda – Biyagama and BihinduWinuwara – Delgoda

title: SLMMF media workshop held in Mawanella
author: Author not found
Content: A media workshop titled ‘Media in the 21st Century – Electronic and Social Media’ was organised by the Sri Lanka Muslim Media Forum (SLMMF) and held at Baduriya College, Mawanella auditorium on 29 July. This workshop marked the 74th edition of such events conducted by the SLMMF. The workshop was chaired by Al-haj N. M. Ameen, the present President of SLMMF, and A. L. A. Rahuman, the Principal of Baduriya College. Notably, the SLMMF has been consistently conducting media workshops and awareness programmes in Muslim schools across the country. The aim is to nurture talented media professionals with the necessary skills to thrive in our technologically advancing world. The event was organised by the Old Girls’ Association (OGA) of Baduriya College and lasted from 9.00 a.m. to 4.30 p.m. Over 120 students from both senior and junior levels of the school actively participated in the workshop. Dr. M. C. M. Rasmin, a Senior Lecturer at the Telecom University, delivered a special lecture for teachers currently teaching journalism in schools within the Kegalle District, as well as old girls and undergraduates. The workshop also included training sessions conducted by Thaha Muzammil, a Consultant of SLMMF, on ‘Social Media and its Pros and Cons’ and by Javed Munawwar and Ashraff  A. Samad on ‘Technology and Media’ and ‘Video Photography’, respectively. The Chief Guest at the certificate presentation ceremony was Tharique Mohammed Ariful Islam, the High Commissioner of Bangladesh in Sri Lanka. He commended the SLMMF for its significant contribution to the advancement of the media profession over the past two decades as a volunteer organisation in the industry. By NaalirJamaldeen

title: Illegal fishing methods, bane to traditional fishers
author: Author not found
Content: Fisheries Minister Douglas Devananda expressed concern yesterday (31 July) over the widespread use of illegal fishing practices, such as fishing with dynamite, which has had a significant impact on fisheries in the Northern and Eastern Provinces. Devananda said if the situation continues, the fishing industry in the region will suffer greatly, affecting the livelihoods of local fishermen who still rely on traditional fishing methods. He pointed out that the use of illegal fishing techniques has become a common problem in both the Eastern and Northern provinces in recent times. To combat this issue, Minister Devananda sought the assistance and support of Eastern Province Governor Senthil Thondaman. They recently met in Colombo to discuss various fisheries-related issues prevailing in the province and the collaborative efforts needed to address them. Governor Thondaman said since taking office, he has been made aware by several civil organisations in the Eastern Province about the prevalence of illegal fishing methods in the area. The use of dynamite for fishing was of significant concern, he said. Meanwhile, Thondaman requested Devananda to promote aquaculture in the lagoons and water bodies coming under the Department of Forest and Wildlife Conservation. Despite efforts to release these areas red tape has prevented it, he said. Devananda acknowledged the importance of addressing these issues and assured Thondaman he would tackle illegal fishing practices and support sustainable aquaculture in the region. By Naalir Jamaldeen

title: Probe commences on LPL National Anthem controversy
author: Author not found
Content: The Ministry of Public Administration, Home Affairs, Provincial Councils, and Local Government has commenced a probe into the controversy where the National Anthem had allegedly been distorted during the opening ceremony of the 2023 Lanka Premier League (LPL). Popular Sri Lankan singer Umara Sinhawansa has faced criticism on social media for her rendition of the national anthem during the LPL tournament’s opening ceremony. Many users on social media have pointed out that the singer mispronounced certain key phrases of the national anthem. In a statement issued by Ministry Secretary Ranjith Asoka, it was said that the distortion of the national anthem according to the whims and fancy of an individual is tantamount to an unconstitutional act. “The incident of a distorted version of the national anthem being sung during an event that garners international attention is regrettable,” the statement said. BY Methmalie Dissanayake

title: GMOF laments inefficiency plaguing Health Sector
author: Author not found
Content: With the number of issues plaguing the State health service increasing, doctors called for the position of the Director General Health Services (DGHS) to be revisited. A spokesperson for the Government Medical Officers’ Forum (GMOF) yesterday (31 July) accused parties with vested interests of having usurped a Director General of Dr. Anil Jasinghe’s calibre and overlooked even the Deputy Directors General who were more suitable both professionally and academically to uphold the position.  He lamented that the DGHS post was being prostituted with persons who had no idea of what managing a health system was. The spokesperson noted that the deaths related to medicinal drugs, shortage of essential drugs, and the cost of pharmaceuticals in private sector pharmacies were not only due to corruption. What is not seen or discussed is the general inefficiency in administration and management of services in the government health service. Recent incident of a death following an assault on a patient due to his alleged behaviour only reflects the mentality of the health assistants at the National Institute of Mental Health of having become complacent to the extent that they physically assaulted a man who was mentally ill. The spokesperson observed that six months ago the Deputy Director of the National Hospital, Colombo had almost been manhandled for having accused health assistants for using and selling harmful substances. But till date the Health Department has failed to initiate proper disciplinary action against perpetrators.He accused the Deputy Director General of Lady Ridgeway Hospital of coming on national television to give explanation regarding to the controversial issue related to a kidney patient when a scan would have revealed that the two kidneys were joined without him explaining it. A patient lost her life after taking injections for indigestion.  The GMOF Spokesperson noted that the incumbent DGHS could not even appoint permanent medical administrators to fill the 60 positions that were vacant. They include some important posts in the Colombo District. He lamented that all these issues were a result of maladministration due to the general inefficiency that is affecting the entire State health sector. By Dilanthi Jayamanne

title: State health service short of funds
author: Author not found
Content: The funds allocated for the State health sector by the Treasury are insufficient at present and the President has agreed to allocate an additional Rs 13 billion to resolve several issues in the sector, Additional Secretary of the Ministry of Health, Dr. Saman Rathnayake said. Speaking to the media following an event in Kandy on 29 July, Dr. Rathnayake said in a bid to ensure the quality and authenticity of medical supplies, the Ministry has decided to procure medicines and accessories exclusively from registered suppliers of the National Medicines Regulatory Authority (NMRA). “Only suppliers registered with the NMRA will be invited to submit tenders for future drug and accessory purchases,” he added. “Regarding the procurement of medicines and devices essential for the health and dental sectors, the SPC ordered approximately 1,700 items in 2021. However, due to the rise in the dollar’s price, the expected delivery of these items was delayed until 2022. Suppliers have requested a price revision due to currency fluctuations,” he said. Dr. Rathnayake highlighted the limited number of suppliers in this sector, and due to considerable price hikes, many related orders had to be cancelled. The process of purchasing necessary medicines and equipment through tenders is estimated to take at least nine months. To address emergency treatment requirements, a list of 270 vital medicines and equipment has been prepared after discussions with relevant suppliers, he said. Under a special procurement process for emergency purchases, the required support has been obtained from dental suppliers. With these measures, the present shortage will be resolved within four months, the Additional Secretary said. By Kamal Suraweera – Kandy

title: Fuel Pass QR Code completes one year
author: Author not found
Content: The National Fuel Pass QR Code completed one year on 29 July. The system was introduced to provide a relief to the fuel crisis in the country caused by the scarcity of the foreign reserves. According to the Ministry of Power and Energy, the QR Code system has now garnered a total of 6.5 million registered members. Within the first 24 hours of its launch, the QR Code facility saw an impressive 1,000,000 individuals registering for the service, the Ministry said. Meanwhile, the Ministry recently announced that discussions will be conducted with all the relevant factions to determine whether to abolish the QR Code system or increase the existing fuel quota, following the entry of foreign companies into the local fuel market. (MD)

title: Food shortage imminent
author: Author not found
Content: Minister of Agriculture Mahinda Amaraweera has expressed concern over the possibility of a food shortage in the country if the upcoming season is affected by the ongoing drought. He expressed his concern while participating in a gardening programme held in Angunukolapalassa. During his speech, the Minister emphasised the importance of ensuring food security for the people. He pointed out that the Government currently lacks a rice reserve and is facing financial constraints, making it challenging to maintain one. However, he stressed that it is crucial to address this issue and not let the people suffer from starvation. Given the prevailing circumstances, Minister Amaraweera highlighted that the supply of rice for animal feed and alcohol production may have to be halted to prioritise the availability of rice for human consumption. The Minister urged everyone to work diligently in areas with available water sources to cultivate crops and not solely depend on rice but utilise other available food sources. He emphasised the need for collective efforts to overcome the challenges posed by the drought and secure food supplies for the population. BY Methmalie Dissanayake

title: President vows to resolve HRCSL staff shortage
author: Author not found
Content: Although the Human Rights Commission of Sri Lanka (HRCSL) has received approximately 11,000 public complaints so far, an acute staff shortage has hindered the commission’s ability to efficiently resolve cases, HRCSL members informed President Ranil Wickremesinghe. According to the President’s Media Division (PMD), the HRCSL conveyed this concern to the President during a meeting held on 29 July. The HRCSL officials also expressed their concerns about the challenges they face due to a staff shortage, which affects their ability to effectively address these complaints. In response, President Wickremesinghe assured them that immediate action will be taken to resolve the staff shortage issue and swiftly address the pending complaints. He stressed the significance of efficiently resolving these matters, the PMD said. Further, the President requested the HRCSL to promptly develop and present a comprehensive set of guidelines for government officials and the Police. He said such guidelines could potentially help reduce the number of complaints reaching the Commission by providing clear directions on rights-related issues, the PMD added. (MD)

title: Ports Ministry says Harin’s statement ‘NOT TRUE’
author: By Sulochana Ramiah Mohan
Content: The Ministry of Ports, Shipping and Aviation has categorically stated that there is no truth to the claims made by Minister of Tourism Harin Fernando, during the Mumbai tourism roadshow, that an Indian investor might take control of the three main airports in Sri Lanka, including the BIA. The Tourism Minister, speaking at the Outbound Travel Mart (OTM), India’s leading and only travel show focused on outbound travel, said, “I will break the news that Indian companies are taking our three airports which is going to be a phenomenal decision to really help us. The fuel tanks are taken by the Indian companies, the solar power projects are also taken by the Indians.” Further, the Minister of Tourism also told a Hindu Businessline journalist and the Hindustan Times, Pune News and many other Indian media outlets that were present at the roadshow that discussions are underway between the two sides, potentially involving management contracts. The newspaper quoted Minister Fernando as stating that the Adani Group is in negotiations with Sri Lankan authorities to manage three airports in the island nation, including the BIA. He mentioned plans to collaborate with the Adani Group for airport management, as reported by Businessline on the sidelines of the OTM show in Mumbai. Sources informed Ceylon Today that Minister Fernando has been requested to provide clarification on the matter, as the Sri Lankan Government has no plans to allocate shares to any foreign investors for the BIA or the Ratmalana International Airport. The only finalised agreement concerns the sale of the Mattala Airport to a Russo-Indian joint venture. According to the Aviation Ministry, the statement made by Minister Fernando during the Mumbai roadshow regarding the transfer of the three airports to an Indian investor was misleading information. The Government has clarified that there are no such plans in place for such a transfer. Additionally, the State-Owned Enterprise Restructuring Unit has stated that they have no knowledge of the developments regarding the airport proposals. Ceylon Today has previously reported that the Mattala Airport will be managed by Russia’s Airports of Regions Management Company (AR), in collaboration with an Indian firm, as a joint venture. Sources indicate that the Indian company involved in this venture is likely to be the Adani Group. Secretary of Sri Lanka’s Ministry of Ministry of Ports, Shipping and Aviation K.D.S. Ruwanchandra, however, told Ceylon Today that discussions have led to an agreement to transfer the operations of MRIA to a private joint venture and it is being finalised, but the Secretary did not disclose the names of the investors.

title: China can join SL debt relief efforts – Sitharaman
author: Author not found
Content: As a large creditor to Sri Lanka, China is welcome to join the effort steered by Japan, India and France to help the island nation cope with its debt distress, India’s Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman said on 29 July. She also called on the International Monetary Fund (IMF) and the World Bank to speed up relief measures for countries facing debt vulnerabilities. Terming multilateral development banks’ (MDBs) reforms and debt-relief measures for many stressed economies as the top two finance track priorities for India during its G20 Presidency, Sitharaman said a comprehensive, better and quicker approach is required to address the problem within the common framework of the IMF and World Bank, as well as “outside” it. “I quote the ‘outside of it’ equally as much as within the framework, as we have the example of Sri Lanka, a middle-income country which got into distress because its earnings were limited to tourism and some other areas like export of tea… Sri Lanka required a quick redressal, although outside of the framework because they are a middle-income country,” she noted in a discussion at the India Japan Forum. In Sri Lanka’s case, Japan, which holds the G7 Presidency currently, quickly took the lead to address the distress, she pointed out. “Japan came up, along with France and India, with a quick committee of creditors group, which started addressing the issue. And of course, it was an open forum, it wasn’t limited to just the three countries, China is welcome to participate as one of the big creditors,” Sitharaman said. Japan’s leadership in such cases with “a constructive approach to address debt distress” has been well-received, the Minister said, adding that this is an indicator that the G7 and G20 together would come up with solutions to the problem. While the MDBs are acting to alleviate debt distress, they need to be “more nimble”, the Minister said, noting that “we are looking at situations where countries are waiting for more than three or four years after the application seeking some redressal, to get the actual resolution of the issues”. (The Hindu)

title: Strict action against errant dealers – Kanchana
author: Author not found
Content: Minister of Power and Energy Kanchana Wijesekera said strict action will be taken against filling stations that do not maintain sufficient stocks. According to the Ceylon Petroleum Corporation (CPC), 101 fuel station dealers for 92 Octane Petrol and 61 fuel station dealers for Lanka Auto Diesel have failed to maintain the required 50 per cent stock capacity. “However, these dealers have placed adequate orders to maintain stock requirements as of 29 July,” the Minister tweeted recently. Additionally, Wijesekera highlighted that the CPC has assumed management control of several fuel stations that were found to be operating below the minimum stock levels. Further, legal action has been instituted against multiple other dealers in response to the situation. While assuring that the CPC has sufficient stocks available for delivery, the Minister requested all fuel station dealers to maintain appropriate stocks and place their orders in accordance with requirements. Meanwhile, the CPC has notified about the fuel price revision expected next month. By Sanjana Marzook

title: Power cuts in SP if Samanala Wewa water released to Udawalawa Reservoir – CEB
author: Author not found
Content: The Ceylon Electricity Board (CEB) has announced that in the event of water being released from the Samanala Wewa to the Udawalawa Reservoir, power cuts lasting three hours will have to be implemented in the Southern Province. This revelation came to light during a discussion, held at the Ministry of Agriculture, which was chaired by the Minister of Agriculture, Mahinda Amaraweera. The discussion was initiated in response to protests by farmers, in recent days, demanding a sufficient water supply for their cultivation needs. During the meeting, officials from the Ministries of Agriculture, Mahaweli Development, Irrigation, and Power explored the possibility of obtaining water from the Samanala Wewa to replenish the Udawalawa Reservoir for a duration of 10 days. The CEB officials warned that such an action would result in a further decrease in water levels, leading to power cuts lasting one to three hours in the Southern Province. As per estimates, the existing water crisis could cause a loss of Rs 16.81 billion in paddy cultivation and an additional Rs 1.6 billion loss due to the disruption of power generation in the coming week. The Agriculture Minister highlighted that this situation could result in a total loss of approximately Rs 30 billion and severely impact rice production this year, too.

title: Macron meets President Wickremesinghe
author: Author not found
Content: French President Emmanuel Macron, who visited Sri Lanka on Friday (28), held extensive discussions with President Ranil Wickremesinghe, the President’s Media Division (PMD) said. According to the PMD, during the discussion, President Wickremesinghe expressed admiration for France’s significant role in global affairs, particularly in areas such as climate mitigation, global debt restructuring, and matters related to the Indo-Pacific region. In a Tweet following the discussions, President Macron said, “Sri Lanka and France are two nations in the Indian Ocean sharing the same goal: an open, inclusive and prosperous Indo-Pacific. In Colombo we confirmed it: strong as in our 75 years of diplomatic relations, we would open a new era to our partnership.”

title: President agrees to up doctors’ salaries
author: Author not found
Content: President Ranil Wickremesinghe has agreed to provide a significant salary increase for doctors in the upcoming Budget, the Government Medical Officers’ Association (GMOA) said yesterday (30). During a media briefing, GMOA Secretary Dr. Haritha Aluthge, highlighted the issue of low salaries, which has led many doctors to consider leaving the country for greener pastures. “Only Rs 28 is paid to a doctor for seeing a patient in the Outpatient Department. About Rs 36 to see a patient in a clinic. Interns are even more unfairly treated. All these have affected the doctors who have become very disappointed due to this, and it has become the main reason for them to leave the country because of the injustice done to them,” he said. The President has acknowledged the seriousness of the situation and has initiated discussions with the Ministry of Finance to address the issue, Dr. Aluthge said and added that the first steps towards a resolution will be taken through the upcoming Budget, and they are optimistic that it will bring about positive change. He said there is an urgent need to introduce a fair salary system for doctors based on their proposals to retain and motivate medical professionals in the country. By Methmalie Dissanayake

title: Rajarata University conducts leishmaniasis awareness programmes
author: Author not found
Content: Several awareness programmes were conducted in selected areas of Anuradhapura District through the ECLIPSE Project in collaboration with the Department of Community Medicine, Faculty of Medicine and Allied Sciences, Rajarata University of Sri Lanka, to alert people about leishmaniasis, which is spreading rapidly in various parts of the island.  The vector of Leishmaniasis is the sand fly, and the causative agent is the parasite Leishmania. As leishmaniasis is a preventable and curable disease, people should go to a government hospital to receive proper treatment if they have a lump, blister or sore on a skin surface that does not heal for a long time. Due to ignorance about the disease and ignoring the symptoms, small lumps, blisters, and wounds that occur at the beginning are likely to develop into large ones, so patients should go to a government hospital when symptoms appear to get the necessary treatment. Several awareness programmes and medical clinics were conducted in Padaviya, Thalawa, and Nachchaduwa at schools, funeral welfare societies and places of worship by the ECLIPSE project with the involvement of professors and a group of medical students of the Faculty of Medicine and Allied Sciences, Rajarata University. Community empowerment through engagement and participation was the key element of these programmes conducted through the ECLIPSE project.

title: Minister Chandrakanthan inspects Kottiyar Bridge construction
author: Author not found
Content: TMVP Leader, Sivanesathurai Chandrakanthan, in his capacity as the State Minister for Rural Road Development, recently engaged in an observation tour to check the progress of the Kottiyar Bridge being built across Verugal Aru in Trincomalee. Under the supervision of the Road Development Authority, this new Kottiyar Bridge, which is being constructed by a local contractor, is 25 metres long and 5 metres wide. The estimated project cost is Rs 50 million. The State Minister instructed the officials of the Eastern Provincial Office of the Road Development Authority and the officials of the contracting company to complete the construction work promptly and open the bridge to the public expeditiously. Officials of the Eastern Provincial Office of the Road Development Authority and contractors participated in this observation tour.

title: Toastmasters Int’l District 82 Conference concludes
author: Author not found
Content: The highly anticipated annual District Conference of District 82 Toastmasters International, Ovation 2023, recently concluded with a grand celebration of public speaking excellence and personal growth. Held at the prestigious BMICH in Colombo from 26 to 28 May, this three-day conference brought together passionate Toastmasters across the district under the inspiring slogan ‘Transform to empower.’ Ovation 2023 lived up to its reputation as a premier event for aspiring speakers, providing a platform for participants to enhance their communication skills, exchange ideas, and forge new connections. The conference boasted a dynamic lineup of educational sessions from personalities including the 2017 World Champion of Public Speaking Manoj Vasudevan, interactive workshops, and engaging networking activities leaving attendees inspired and motivated to excel in their speaking journeys. One of the conference highlights was the highly competitive speech contests, showcasing the best speakers nationwide. With talent and charisma on full display, contestants competed in several categories, including the International Speech contest, Table Topics Speech Contest, Evaluation Speech contest, and Humorous Speech contest. Commenting on the success of the conference, District 82 District Director, Nisal Weerakoon, DTM, said “Ovation 2023 has been a remarkable event that has inspired and empowered our members to become better communicators and leaders. The talent displayed in the speech contests was truly outstanding, reflecting our participants’ dedication and hard work. We congratulate the winners and all the participants for their remarkable performances.” As Ovation 2023 came to a close, attendees departed with a renewed sense of purpose, armed with invaluable skills and connections acquired during the conference. The event served as a testament to the transformative power of Toastmasters International, fostering personal growth, and empowering individuals to become effective communicators and leaders. With the success of Ovation 2023, the future holds even more tremendous promise for District 82 and its passionate members.

title: Youth killed in Keselwatta shooting
author: Author not found
Content: A 20-year-old individual was killed in a shooting at Martis Lane in Keselwatta yesterday evening (30). According to Police, two unidentified gunmen, riding a motorcycle, targeted the youth who was standing by the roadside. They opened fire and fled the scene, leaving the victim with serious injuries, as confirmed by Police. The victim was rushed to the Colombo National Hospital, but succumbed to his injuries subsequently. The deceased is a resident of Colombo 12.

title: Rupee fluctuation is temporary
author: Author not found
Content: State Minister of Finance Ranjith Siyambalapitiya, yesterday (30), said the recent fluctuation in the LKR value is temporary and is influenced by the dynamics of demand and supply. According to Siyambalapitiya, the Government has adopted a policy of allowing the value of the USD and the rupee to be determined by the forces of supply and demand.  He said during domestic debt restructuring, around USD 750 million of Sri Lanka’s Development Bonds were converted into Sri Lanka Rupees, as agreed upon. The Minister explained that to provide the necessary funds to depositors, banks are required to accumulate dollar deposits, which creates a situation where they can limit the release of dollars to the market.  This could lead to an increase in the value of the dollar against the rupee, he pointed out.  Speaking further, the State Minister said these factors, along with other issues, contributed to the recent depreciation of the rupee and the increase in the value of the dollar. This situation is temporary and is a result of the natural fluctuations in demand and supply in the currency market, he added.

title: Grave crimes against women on the rise
author: Author not found
Content: Recent statistics from the Sri Lanka Police Performance Report2022, presented to Parliament on 18 July, reveal a concerning rise in grave crimes (GC) against women. The number of reported crimes increased by 5.63 per cent, totaling 600 cases in 2022, compared to 568 cases in the previous year, 2021. Among the various grave crimes committed against adult women in 2022, rape topped the list with 182 reported cases. Although there was a slight decline of 2.67 per cent from the previous year, this remains a deeply worrying concern. The second highest crime reported was ‘grievous hurt’, with 154 cases, showing a significant increase of 27.27 per cent year on year. Homicides, the third highest on the list, increased by 29.11 per cent with 102 cases reported in 2022. Other grave crimes against women include ‘causing injuries by using a sharp instrument’ with 74 cases, down by 1.37 per cent from the previous year and kidnappings with 43 cases, showing a decrease of 12.24 per cent. The report also highlights that ‘grave sexual abuse’ against women accounted for 21 cases, indicating a decline of 12.50 per cent. Similarly, attempted murder cases totaled 11, down by 9.09 per cent from the previous year. BY Paneetha Ameresekere

title: Tilvin claims APC was intended to win support of Tamils and India
author: Author not found
Content: Janatha Vimukthi Peramuna (JVP) General Secretary Tilvin Silva claimed that President Ranil Wickremesinghe’s intention behind the all-party conference was to gain the support of the Tamil people and India for the upcoming presidential election. Silva criticised the conference, labelling it as yet another deceptive move by the President. The JVP chose not to participate in the conference, as they believed it would be futile, similar to previous conferences, he said. He claimed that the President’s objective seemed to be securing the backing of the Tamil community and India for the presidential election, but he lacks a clear democratic strategy for power-sharing or amending the thirteenth constitution. According to Silva, it is absurd to claim that one person lacks the power to make laws, when they have the authority to sell the country’s resources and pass laws of their choosing. He pointed out that the crucial issues facing the country remain unresolved. Silva further stressed that if the government were to call for another all-party conference, they should first state their position clearly to the Opposition before expecting the Opposition to respond to their stand. BY Anuradha Herath

title: Arrested for raping13-year-olddaughter
author: Author not found
Content: The Police on Thursday (27) arrested a 49-year-old individual, who had raped his elder daughter nine years ago when she was just 13 years old. The abuse had taken place after the victim’s mother had left the family. However, when the grandmother found out about it, she had moved in to protect and support the two girls. When the victim got married, she had revealed about the abuses she had to gone to her husband. Upon receiving the complaint and investigating the matter, the Police apprehended the 49-year-old suspect. (To report child abuses dial 1929: the hotline of National Child Protection Authority (NCPA))

title: NIMH mum over patient’s death
author: Author not found
Content: Hot on the heels of medicinal drug related deaths that have taken place in the State health sector, a patient’s death, allegedly following an assault by a ‘certain category of health staff’, was reported from the National Institute of Mental Health (NIMH), Angoda earlier this week. Informed sources yesterday (27) said the 48-year-old patient from Watareka, who was allegedly suffering from bipolar disorder, had been admitted to Ward 08 of the NIMH on 20 July, under the BHT 3245/2023. However, earlier this week he had allegedly succumbed to injuries sustained following an assault by a certain staff category of ward. They were allegedly attempting to restrain the patient. Ceylon Today learns the post-mortem, which had been performed subsequently, had revealed the deceased had suffered extensive multiple contusions due to the assault which resulted in an internal bleeding. Also, it was reported that when the alleged incident happened four nurses and four supportive staff were on duty. When queried, the Administration of the Hospital refused to comment saying that the Circular issued by the Health Ministry Secretary prevented them from issuing any comment to the media.  Meanwhile, the family of the deceased has lodged a complaint with the Mulleriyawa Police. The family accused the hospital of allegedly attempting to cover up the patient’s death. By Dilanthi Jayamanne

title: French President makes historic Colombo visit today
author: Author not found
Content: French President Emmanuel Macron will arrive in Sri Lanka today (28), marking the first-ever visit by a French President to Sri Lanka. His tour reflects France’s focus on asserting its Indo-Pacific strategy. During his visit to Colombo, President Macron will engage in bilateral discussions with President Ranil Wickremesinghe, aimed at addressing shared regional and global challenges. This meeting carries great significance, as it strengthens the diplomatic relations between France and Sri Lanka. The President’s Media Division (PMD) has issued a statement confirming the meeting and emphasising the importance of this momentous occasion. The Foreign Ministry added that the official discussion, between the two Heads of State, will centre on an exchange of views on global, economic and political affairs. The French President will be accompanied by French Minister for Europe and Foreign Affairs Catherine Colonna and a high-level delegation comprising senior officials of the French Government. President Macron has embarked on an official visit to Papua New Guinea, New Caledonia and Vanuatu, becoming the first French President to visit these countries since 1966. His visit was to explain France’s unique Indo-Pacific strategy in these countries. Notably, on 23 June, during the Conference for a New Global Financial Agreement, President Macron and President Wickremesinghe met and had a cordial discussion. Macron extended invitations to world leaders, including President Wickremesinghe, to participate in the Global Leaders’ Summit for a New Global Financing Pact. By Sulochana Ramiah Mohan

title: Ports Ministry says Harin’s statement ‘NOT TRUE’
author: By Sulochana Ramiah Mohan
Content: The Ministry of Ports, Shipping and Aviation has categorically stated that there is no truth to the claims made by Minister of Tourism Harin Fernando, during the Mumbai tourism roadshow, that an Indian investor might take control of the three main airports in Sri Lanka, including the BIA. The Tourism Minister, speaking at the Outbound Travel Mart (OTM), India’s leading and only travel show focused on outbound travel, said, “I will break the news that Indian companies are taking our three airports which is going to be a phenomenal decision to really help us. The fuel tanks are taken by the Indian companies, the solar power projects are also taken by the Indians.” Further, the Minister of Tourism also told a Hindu Businessline journalist and the Hindustan Times, Pune News and many other Indian media outlets that were present at the roadshow that discussions are underway between the two sides, potentially involving management contracts. The newspaper quoted Minister Fernando as stating that the Adani Group is in negotiations with Sri Lankan authorities to manage three airports in the island nation, including the BIA. He mentioned plans to collaborate with the Adani Group for airport management, as reported by Businessline on the sidelines of the OTM show in Mumbai. Sources informed Ceylon Today that Minister Fernando has been requested to provide clarification on the matter, as the Sri Lankan Government has no plans to allocate shares to any foreign investors for the BIA or the Ratmalana International Airport. The only finalised agreement concerns the sale of the Mattala Airport to a Russo-Indian joint venture. According to the Aviation Ministry, the statement made by Minister Fernando during the Mumbai roadshow regarding the transfer of the three airports to an Indian investor was misleading information. The Government has clarified that there are no such plans in place for such a transfer. Additionally, the State-Owned Enterprise Restructuring Unit has stated that they have no knowledge of the developments regarding the airport proposals. Ceylon Today has previously reported that the Mattala Airport will be managed by Russia’s Airports of Regions Management Company (AR), in collaboration with an Indian firm, as a joint venture. Sources indicate that the Indian company involved in this venture is likely to be the Adani Group. Secretary of Sri Lanka’s Ministry of Ministry of Ports, Shipping and Aviation K.D.S. Ruwanchandra, however, told Ceylon Today that discussions have led to an agreement to transfer the operations of MRIA to a private joint venture and it is being finalised, but the Secretary did not disclose the names of the investors.

title: Petition against waiving off EPF, ETF loans fixed for consideration
author: Author not found
Content: The Supreme Court has fixed 27 August to consider the Petition, seeking an order to prevent the Government from waiving off loans obtained from the Employees’ Provident Fund (EPF) and Employees’ Trust Fund (ETF), during the Domestic Debt Optimisation (DDO) process. This decision came after the Attorney General requested more time to submit limited objections, related to the Petition, during yesterday’s (27)hearing. Attorney-at-Law Sunil Watagala filed the Petition on behalf of the Inter-Company Employees’ Union, its President Wasantha Samarasinghe and six others. The Petition seeks to restrain the Government from waiving off loans acquired from the EPF and ETF as part of the Domestic Debt Optimisation process.

title: Dies while waiting in Aswesuma queue
author: Author not found
Content: A heartbreaking incident occurred at the Ella Divisional Secretariat yesterday morning (27) where a 77-year-old man, identified as Ramasamy Kulandaivelu, lost his life while waiting in a queue to submit his application for the Aswesuma welfare benefits. The man, a resident of Tonacombe estate in Namunukula, had arrived at the secretariat in the early hours of the morning, hoping to receive the much-needed benefits. According to the Ella Police, Ramasamy Kulandaivelu had been waiting in the queue before the office’s regular working hours began. Unfortunately, while standing in the queue, he suddenly fell and tragically passed away on the spot. BY Saman Palitha Nanayakkara – Haldummulla

title: Medical administrators instructed to use fingerprint machines
author: Author not found
Content: The Health Ministry has instructed Medical Administration services officers to use the fingerprint machines to mark their daily arrival and departure with effect from 1 August 2023 in order determine to who receives extra duty and overtime payments. Welcoming the move, informed sources of the Health Ministry said yesterday (27), that issuing an internal memo an Additional Secretary (Administration 01) had informed all Additional Secretaries, Director General Health Services (DGHS) and all Chief Financial Officers that finger printing should be done in order to pay extra duty allowances, approved by the Cabinet of Ministers during their meeting, to all medical Administrative service officers. Accordingly, all administrative grade officers including Medical Administrative Service officers should commence using of the finger print machine to mark their ‘in’ and ‘out’, they noted. Ministry sources said that the memo had also noted that measures should be taken to inform all relevant officers that the activities related to the use of fingerprint machines should be conducted in coordination with the relevant departments By Dilanthi Jayamanne

title: Govt agencies provided no info on most Interim Budget 2022 proposals – Verite
author: Author not found
Content: The implementation status of 71 per cent of the highest value expenditure proposals, in Interim Budget 2022, with an allocation of LKR 46.8 billion, remains unknown, according to Verité Research. Verité Research has been tracking the progress of budget promises since 2017, and Interim Budget 2022 has the largest proportion of proposals for which information was not provided. On average, information was not disclosed to assess progress of 38 per cent of the expenditure proposals between 2017-2021. For most of the Interim Budget 2022 proposals, no information was provided by the government agencies, even for requests made under the Right to Information (RTI) Act.  This has been a continuing trend since 2017. The Interim Budget 2022 assessment tracked 24 expenditure proposals made in the budget speech, with a total allocation of LKR 50.5 billion. Information received was sufficient to assess the progress of seven proposals, and the assessment revealed that only one proposal had been fulfilled as of 31 December 2022. The findings are published on the ‘Budget Promises’ dashboard housed under the publicfinance.lk platform of Verité Research. The assessments over the years reveal that a key factor that contributes to poor disclosure of progress is the confusion over who is responsible for implementation of the proposals. The National Budget Department (NBD) of the Ministry of Finance is responsible for budget implementation but is not fully aware of the agencies responsible for the implementation of proposals. For example, the agencies identified by the NBD as being responsible for implementation claimed they are not responsible for the implementation of 17 out of the 24 proposals tracked. This indicates one of two possibilities, the Verité Research said. “One is that the NBD, which is responsible for the estimation and appropriation of public finance resources, is unaware who the implementing agencies are. The other possibility is that the agencies are not aware that they are responsible for the implementation of these proposals. Both possibilities raise serious concerns about the accountability of the government in delivering promises made by the Minister of Finance in his budget speech in Parliament.”  The Interim Budget 2022 was presented at a crucial juncture in Sri Lanka’s history, where the country was mired in an economic crisis unlike any it has faced since independence. The budget strived to provide hope by promising to lay the foundation to change the economic trajectory of the country. These findings raise doubts as to whether Sri Lanka can genuinely expect a sustainable change in its economic trajectory without addressing the core problem that led to the crisis; lack of transparency and accountability in how the government manages the public funds, Verité Research alleged.

title: Teenage girl’s death a mystery
author: Author not found
Content: Kedeeswari Dharmika, a 17-year-old girl, who worked in a house in Vaddukottai, in the Jaffna peninsula, was found dead under suspicious circumstances recently. She had been paid only Rs 5,000 per month for her work, her relatives told the Jaffna Police.  Concerned relatives of the girl informed the Jaffna Police, that the post-mortem, conducted at the Jaffna Hospital, revealed signs of abuse on her body. In connection with this incident, the Police have arrested her employer. According to the girl’s relatives, Kadeeswari had been working as a maid in the house of her maternal aunt in Vaddukottai. She was hired to work in her aunt’s house after completing her studies at a local school. During her employment, she was not allowed to contact her mother over the phone and was restricted from making calls for more than a few minutes. Whenever she tried to talk to her mother, her employer would stand nearby. In some instances, when the girl was allowed to speak on the phone, she would express distress, indicating that she was facing difficulties and wanted to return home, the relatives alleged. According to the relatives, she passed while in employment, raising doubts among her family members. BY T. Pratheepan – Jaffna

title: President lifts ban on five organisations
author: Author not found
Content: President Ranil Wickremesinghe, acting in his capacity as the Minister of Defence, has issued a Gazette Notification lifting the ban that was imposed on five (05) organisations in the aftermath of the 2019 Easter Sunday terror attacks. According to the Gazette, the organizations no longer proscribed are United Thowheeth Jama’ath (UTJ), Ceylon Thowheeth Jama’ath (CTJ), Sri Lanka Thowheeth Jama’ath (SLTJ), All Ceylon Thowheeth Jama’ath (ACTJ), and Jamiyathul Ansaari Sunnathul Mohomadiya (JSM). In April 2021, the then Attorney General Dappula de Livera authorised the proscription of 11 Islamic Organisations in Sri Lanka due to their involvement in extremist activities. Among the previously proscribed organisations were Dharul Adhar @ Jamiul Adhar, Sri Lanka Islamic Student Movement (SLISM), Islamic State of Iraq and Syria (ISIS), Al-Qaeda, Save the Pearls, and Super Muslim. However, as of the recent Gazette Notification, the ban on these organizations has been lifted.

title: Monk given suspended sentence
author: Author not found
Content: A noted Buddhist monk, who pleaded guilty to three charges, including the sexual abuse of a 13-year-old boy in 2017, was yesterday (27) sentenced to six months rigorous imprisonment on each of the charges, suspended for five-years, by Colombo High Court Judge Manjula Thillakaratne. The Judge also imposed a fine of Rs 3,000, on the accused monk and instructed him, to pay compensation of Rs 500,000, to the aggrieved party. Upon the accused pleading guilty to the aforementioned offence, he pleaded guilty to a separate charge of sexually abusing another minor, 12-months later and he was duly sentenced to one-year RI suspended for five-years, by Colombo High Court (CHC) Judge Damith Thotawatta. The Judge slapped a fine of Rs 2,000, on the accused monk and instructed him to pay compensation of Rs 100,000, to the victimised child. BY Hansi Nanayakkara

title: JAT Holdings PLC bullish about Africa
author: Author not found
Content: In line with the investment priorities outlined in its IPO, JAT Holdings PLC, the market leader in wood coating in Sri Lanka, Bangladesh, and the Maldives, officially expanded to Africa in July 2023, through the incorporation of ‘JAT Paints Africa Limited’ in Kenya, through a joint venture with Mayleen Corp – a Kenya-based diversified business house. Accordingly, the Joint Venture Agreement was signed by Aelian Gunawardene, Managing Director of JAT Holdings PLC and Ruwan Fernando Managing Director of Mayleen (K) Limited, a member of Mayleen Corp in Kenya. This strategic move is set to strengthen JAT’s position as a leader in wood coatings across Africa, following its exceptional success in South Asia. Fulfilling its commitments to investors, the establishment of JAT Paints Africa in Kenya showcases JAT Holdings PLC’s commitment to expanding its footprint in the East African region and emerging as a leader in wood coatings in Africa. Through this partnership, JAT Holdings will now be able to manufacture and distribute the brand of Sayerlack Wood Coatings and other JAT products in key markets across Kenya and East Africa.  Expressing optimism and discussing the Group’s strategic goals, Aelian Gunawardena – Founder and Managing Director at JAT Holdings PLC said, “It gives me great pride to announce the successful incorporation of this joint venture with a partner who shares our vision for the wood coatings industry. We plan to leverage our wealth of experience and a commitment to innovation, sustainability, providing total solutions and customer satisfaction, to redefine the market and make a lasting impact in Kenya and East Africa. This strategic partnership with Mayleen Corp marks a significant milestone, and together, we are poised to set new standards of excellence. Furthermore, this partnership is aligned with our goal of establishing and growing our business overseas, to further help and support Sri Lanka’s economic rebound and strengthen the export sector.” The acceptance of JAT’s range of wood coatings among the large furniture manufacturers in Nairobi, Gabon, and Lagos, during this visit, was beyond expectation and absolutely encouraging. Mayleen Corp is a dynamic Kenya-based diversified business group with operations spanning across diverse sectors.

title: IRD takeover of RAMIS system discussed
author: Author not found
Content: The Committee on Ways and Means took into discussion the plan to take over the existing RAMIS system, from the Singapore Company, to the Inland Revenue Department (IRD). This was discussed when the Committee on Ways and Means met in Parliament recently. The Committee recently visited the Inland Revenue Department and discussed several issues including the RAMIS system. Accordingly, the Committee met to inquire further into the matter. The Information and Communication Technology Agency (ICTA) was also called before the Committee for the same. Thus, according to the agreement by the Singapore company, dealing with the RAMIS system, the Inland Revenue Department should take over the full responsibility of the RAMIS system from the coming January. It was disclosed that the internal capacity including the human resources required for this has not been developed in the department. The committee recommended that the Inland Revenue Department submit a report in this regard. The Chair also stated that the report should include a structured proposal for updating the system to adopt the RAMIS system. It was also discussed that the RAMIS system, which was introduced eight years ago, is still not fully operational and the Committee expressed their displeasure over this. Another integrated information system to be built by merging 13 government institutions was also discussed at the Committee meeting. Several rounds of discussions were held with 13 concerned institutions in this regard and it was suggested that all these institutions should use the National Identity Number as a common code in their information systems.

title: Abduction case against ex-Navy Chief et all fixed for 30 Nov
author: Author not found
Content: The Colombo High Court Trial-at-Bar yesterday (27) deferred further hearing of the abduction case, filed against former Navy Commander, Admiral of the Fleet Wasantha Karannagoda and 13 other Navy and Army intelligence officers, to 30 November. Among others accused of the abduction and disappearance of 11 children from Colombo and its suburbs, are former Navy Media Spokesman V.K.P. Dassanayake and former Lieutenant Commander Prasad Hettiarachchi. The said case was taken up before the Trial-at-Bar, Bench comprising Judges Amal Ranaraja, Navarattne Marasinghe and Manjula Thillakaratne. Thirteen of the defendants were present in Court, with the exception of the 14th accused Karannagoda. Deputy Solicitor General Yohan Abeywickrema, appearing on behalf of the Attorney General, requested the Bench to fix further hearing of the case after 12 September, as the petition filed by the 14th defendant in the case (Karannagoda), challenging the indictments filed against him, is slated to be called for hearing, on that date by the Court of Appeal. The Attorney General has indicted 14 accused and filed 667 charges against them, before the High Court, for having committed their actions from 8 August 2008 to 21 September 2009. BY Hansi Nanayakkara

title: TRC will be given full authority
author: Author not found
Content: Minister of Foreign Affairs Ali Sabri revealed that once established through an Act, the proposed ‘Truth and Reconciliation Commission’ (TRC) will be granted full authority to garner support and facilitate its implementation and organize international forums, the President’s Media Division (PMD) said yesterday (27). During a discussion at the Presidential Secretariat, Minister Ali Sabri briefed Trade Unions and Civil Organisations about the Truth-Finding Commission. The Minister pointed out the significance of establishing an independent TRC to address the impact of the ethnic problem on affected communities. He emphasised that the government’s role should be limited to providing necessary support and facilities, allowing the commission to operate autonomously. The Cabinet-approved Interim Secretariat is expected to pave the way for expediting the Commission’s operations, he said.  The Minister acknowledged the importance of having an internationally recognised accountability process and reassured that the government is committed to creating such a mechanism. He pledged to take all necessary steps to instill confidence in the TRC.

title: Minuwangoda UNPWC meets on 30 July
author: Author not found
Content: The Minuwangoda Electorate UNP Working Committee Meeting has been scheduled for 3.30 p.m. on 30 July. It will be  chaired by Minuwangoda Chief Organiser Prof. Ashu Marasinghe. Deputy Leader of the UNP Ruwan Wijewardene, Assistant Leader Akila Viraj Kariyawasam, Party Chairman Wajira Abeywardena, Palitha Thewarapperuma, Minister Manusha Nanayakkara, Eksath Lak Wanitha Peramuna (ELWP) President Shanthini Kongahage, Adviser to the President on Trade Unions Saman Ratnapriya and a large number of UNP leaders will participate. A medical camp, with the participation of 35 indigenous medical practitioners, has also been scheduled to be held on the same day while launching a training programme targeting the young men and women, who are looking to go to Japan for employment. It has been planned to spend Rs 200,000 on each. By Naalir Jamaldeen

title: Injured tusker being treated
author: Author not found
Content: An injured tusker, that had been lying in a forest in Vantharumoolai, in Chenkalady Divisional Secretariat area, has been treated through the intervention of the Department of Wildlife Conservation in Batticaloa. Its calf, which had also been roaming near it had been rescued by the wildlife officers and taken to Ampara. The wildlife officers had also taken measures to treat the injured tusker by deploying veterinarians. BY T. L. Farkhan – Batticaloa

title: Title not found
author: Author not found
Content: Date:  The Disaster Management Centre in Sainthamaruthu has launched a two-year project to conduct mass clearance work of salvinia and other harmful aquatic plants, and waste in Thona located in the Kalmunai Municipal Council area. The Kalmunai Municipal Council, Sainthamaruthu Divisional Secretariat, and Sammanthurai Pradeshiya Sabha are providing their fullest support to carry out this project, utilising their heavy vehicles, machinery, and other equipment. The villagers of Sainthamaruthu have been undergoing untold hardship during the rainy season as aquatic plants and solid waste prevent the smooth flow of water to the sea. As a result, the entire village of Sainthamaruthu is flooded. The Thona (estuary) has been facing significant challenges as a result. Deputy Director of Disaster Management, M.C.M. Riyas, announced that strict action will be taken against those who throw solid waste and those who pollute the environment. He also emphasised that unauthorised structures and encroachment will not be allowed in the future. By M.A.P. Deen – Ampara Popular

title: SLMMF workshopin Mawanella tomorrow
author: Author not found
Content: The 74th media workshop of the Sri Lanka Muslim Media Forum (SLMMF) titled ‘Media in the 21st century’ is scheduled for tomorrow (29) at Baduriya Central College in Mawanella. The workshop will be chaired by SLMMF President, Al-haj N. M. Ameen, and Principal of the school, A. L. A. Rahaman. The workshop has been organised by the Past Pupils’ Association of Mawanella Baduriya Central College. Dr. M. C. Rasmin, Thaha Muzammil, Javed Munawwar, and Ashraff A. Samad will be the resource persons. Chief Guest will be the High Commissioner of Bangladesh in Sri Lanka Tharique Mohammed Ariful Islam, who will also award certificates to the participants. Additionally, the Guest of Honour will be the former Head of Islamic Studies Department at the University of Peradeniya, M. I. M. Ameen. In attendance will be teachers who teach media subjects in schools and SLMMF Kegalle District Organiser, Ameer Hussain. Expected participants also include the Forum’s Vice President, M. A. M. Nilam, Treasurer, M. M. Jesmin, and former Media Coordinator Adhil Ali Sabry. During the workshop, a cultural item will be staged by the ‘Sanjaram’ team of the Sri Lanka Broadcasting Corporation (SLBC). By Naalir Jamaldeen

title: Fmr Police Reserve HQ OIC Acquitted
author: Author not found
Content: Colombo High Court Judge Amal Ranaraja, on Wednesday (26), acquitted former OIC of the Sri Lanka Police Reserve Headquarters W. M. Vijith Weerasinghe, from the charges preferred against him without calling for evidence from the Defence. The former OIC was accused of compiling fake documents to hoodwink an SSP, in order to reinstate a Police Constable who had left the service. Judge Ranaraja, who perused a request made by Defence Counsel, as per Provisions in Section 201 of the Criminal Procedure Code, thus instructed the defendant, to be acquitted from charges filed against him and be released from the trial. Defence Counsel Darshana Kuruppu, stated that his client should be acquitted from charges and released from the case as the prosecution had failed to prove the charges beyond a reasonable doubt. He added that though the prosecution had produced six witnesses, including Batticaloa SSP Pandukabaya Samaradiwakara, along with seven documents to substantiate the charges against his client, they had failed to prove those charges. Counsel Kuruppu informed Court that the witnesses had also failed to identify the defendant and insisted that the documents, which had been submitted by the prosecution were not those that were in the possession of the accused. The accused was indicted on three counts on the aforementioned charge in 2008 for a crime committed on or before 6 July, 19 years ago. BY Hansi Nanayakkara

title: Minister inspects Colombo Dockyard built ship ‘SOPHIE GERMAIN’
author: Author not found
Content: The newest Cable Laying and Repair Vessel ‘SOPHIE GERMAIN’  which is located in Colombo Port was inspected yesterday (27) by Minister of Ports, Shipping and Aviation Nimal Siripala de Silva. The ship manufactured for Orange Marine France, is to be used for marine construction and repairs, including laying cables on the seabed. During this inspection the Colombo Dockyard company told the Minister that Sri Lanka has received about 50 million Euros as foreign exchange through the construction of this ship. The width of the ship is 18.80 metres and its length is 100 metres. Colombo Dockyard added that this is the second ship built for Cable Laying and Repair work, and 255 ships have been built and delivered to European and Asian countries on various requests. Accordingly, Dockyard emphasised that European and Asian ship owners have gained confidence in ‘Colombo Dockyard’ and have chosen ‘Colombo Dockyard’ as the most suitable company for ship-building according to their needs in the future. The Minister said, “it is highly appreciated that Colombo Dockyard Company is engaged in a joint venture with the Sri Lanka Port Authority, as a company that manufactures the most modern cruise ships for Europe and the Asian region. Based on that situation, Sri Lanka will be appointed as a hub of ship-building in Asia by expanding the ship-building industry and through this, the young community of Sri Lanka will be able to become professionals rich in industrial knowledge and be directed to many sectors of the ship-building industry.” Chairman of ‘Colombo Dockyard’ company, Hideki Tanaka and Managing Director Thimira S. Godakumbura also participated.

title: MoU aimed at revolutionising agricultural sector signed
author: Author not found
Content: In a momentous occasion, the Department of Agrarian Development, the Sri Lanka Agripreneurs’ Forum (SLAF) and AgroWorld (Pvt) Ltd. joined hands to sign a Memorandum of Understanding (MoU) aimed at revolutionising the agricultural sector in the country. The signing ceremony took place at the Department of Agrarian Development office located at 42, Sir Marcus Fernando Mawatha, Colombo 07, on 25 July from 8.30 a.m. to 9.00 a.m. The MoU represents a significant step forward in the pursuit of sustainable and technology-driven agricultural practices that will lead to enhanced productivity and efficiency in the industry. The three entities, united in their vision, have committed to fostering collaboration, promoting innovative technologies, and facilitating knowledge exchange to empower agripreneurs across the nation. As a highlight of their collaboration, the Department of Agrarian Development, SLAF, and AgroWorld (Pvt) Ltd. are thrilled to announce the launch of the ‘Smart Village’ initiative. This innovative programme aims to uplift talented agripreneurs by providing them with the necessary resources, mentorship, and access to advanced technologies provided via the Agro World platforms. The Smart Village initiative will serve as a model for inclusive and progressive agricultural development across the country. A.H.M.L Aberathne, Commissioner General of the Department of Agrarian Development, expressed his enthusiasm over the partnership, stating, “This MOU marks a historic milestone in Sri Lanka’s agricultural journey. By combining the expertise and resources of the Department, SLAF, and AgroWorld, we are confident in our ability to drive sustainable growth and prosperity in the agriculture sector.” Rizvi Zaheed, Chairman of the Sri Lanka Agripreneurs’ Forum, stated, “We are delighted to join hands with the Department of Agrarian Development and AgroWorld to champion innovation in agriculture. This partnership will empower agripreneurs and create a supportive ecosystem for their success.” Dr. Selvanathan Anojan, Founder and CEO of AgroWorld (Pvt) Ltd., said, “As a private enterprise dedicated to agricultural progress, we are thrilled to collaborate with the Government and SLAF. We hope to address the issues of access to finance, access to scientific growing methods, and access to markets for ground-level farmers. Together, we can leverage technology and innovation to maximise agricultural productivity while preserving the environment.” The signing of the MoU marks the beginning of a transformative journey for Sri Lanka’s agricultural sector, as it witnesses the synergy of three pivotal entities committed to driving positive change. By promoting sustainable practices and empowering agripreneurs, the collaboration aims to pave the way for a prosperous and resilient agricultural future.

title: Saudi Arabia launches Skill Verification Programme in Sri Lanka
author: Author not found
Content: In an effort to draw in more talented employees from Sri Lanka, the Saudi Arabian Ministry of Human Resources and Social Development (MHRSD) inaugurated the Skill Verification Programme (SVP) on Wednesday 12 July 2023. In the first stage of the external track of the programme, which is being implemented under the Ministry’s Professional Accreditation Programme, five professions plumber, electrician, refrigeration/air conditioning technician, automobile mechanic, and automobile electrician were chosen for skill testing. The programme has been introduced by the Ministry in Bangladesh, Pakistan, and India. In an effort to best regulate its labour market, it implemented SVP in July 2021. The first phase of the SVP intends to validate workers’ skills in five specialisations out of the 23 selected by the Ministry, with the goal of increasing the quality of professional workforce in the Saudi labour market and raising the level of professionalism. The goal is also to boost productivity and stop the influx of unskilled professional labour into the Kingdom’s labour market. Through two tracks—internal and international—the SVP seeks to confirm that employees in the targeted professions possess the essential skills. The international track works with a number of recognised international examination centres to examine professional labour before their arrival. By Khalidh Rizwan

title: Ports Ministry says Harin’s statement ‘NOT TRUE’
author: By Sulochana Ramiah Mohan
Content: The Ministry of Ports, Shipping and Aviation has categorically stated that there is no truth to the claims made by Minister of Tourism Harin Fernando, during the Mumbai tourism roadshow, that an Indian investor might take control of the three main airports in Sri Lanka, including the BIA. The Tourism Minister, speaking at the Outbound Travel Mart (OTM), India’s leading and only travel show focused on outbound travel, said, “I will break the news that Indian companies are taking our three airports which is going to be a phenomenal decision to really help us. The fuel tanks are taken by the Indian companies, the solar power projects are also taken by the Indians.” Further, the Minister of Tourism also told a Hindu Businessline journalist and the Hindustan Times, Pune News and many other Indian media outlets that were present at the roadshow that discussions are underway between the two sides, potentially involving management contracts. The newspaper quoted Minister Fernando as stating that the Adani Group is in negotiations with Sri Lankan authorities to manage three airports in the island nation, including the BIA. He mentioned plans to collaborate with the Adani Group for airport management, as reported by Businessline on the sidelines of the OTM show in Mumbai. Sources informed Ceylon Today that Minister Fernando has been requested to provide clarification on the matter, as the Sri Lankan Government has no plans to allocate shares to any foreign investors for the BIA or the Ratmalana International Airport. The only finalised agreement concerns the sale of the Mattala Airport to a Russo-Indian joint venture. According to the Aviation Ministry, the statement made by Minister Fernando during the Mumbai roadshow regarding the transfer of the three airports to an Indian investor was misleading information. The Government has clarified that there are no such plans in place for such a transfer. Additionally, the State-Owned Enterprise Restructuring Unit has stated that they have no knowledge of the developments regarding the airport proposals. Ceylon Today has previously reported that the Mattala Airport will be managed by Russia’s Airports of Regions Management Company (AR), in collaboration with an Indian firm, as a joint venture. Sources indicate that the Indian company involved in this venture is likely to be the Adani Group. Secretary of Sri Lanka’s Ministry of Ministry of Ports, Shipping and Aviation K.D.S. Ruwanchandra, however, told Ceylon Today that discussions have led to an agreement to transfer the operations of MRIA to a private joint venture and it is being finalised, but the Secretary did not disclose the names of the investors.

title: Minuwangoda UNPWC meets on 30 July
author: Author not found
Content: The Minuwangoda Electorate UNP Working Committee Meeting has been scheduled for 3.30 p.m. on 30 July. It will be  chaired by Minuwangoda Chief Organiser Prof. Ashu Marasinghe. Deputy Leader of the UNP Ruwan Wijewardene, Assistant Leader Akila Viraj Kariyawasam, Party Chairman Wajira Abeywardena, Palitha Thewarapperuma, Minister Manusha Nanayakkara, Eksath Lak Wanitha Peramuna (ELWP) President Shanthini Kongahage, Adviser to the President on Trade Unions Saman Ratnapriya and a large number of UNP leaders will participate. A medical camp, with the participation of 35 indigenous medical practitioners, has also been scheduled to be held on the same day while launching a training programme targeting the young men and women, who are looking to go to Japan for employment. It has been planned to spend Rs 200,000 on each. By Naalir Jamaldeen

title: Injured tusker being treated
author: Author not found
Content: An injured tusker, that had been lying in a forest in Vantharumoolai, in Chenkalady Divisional Secretariat area, has been treated through the intervention of the Department of Wildlife Conservation in Batticaloa. Its calf, which had also been roaming near it had been rescued by the wildlife officers and taken to Ampara. The wildlife officers had also taken measures to treat the injured tusker by deploying veterinarians. BY T. L. Farkhan – Batticaloa

title: Title not found
author: Author not found
Content: Date:  The Disaster Management Centre in Sainthamaruthu has launched a two-year project to conduct mass clearance work of salvinia and other harmful aquatic plants, and waste in Thona located in the Kalmunai Municipal Council area. The Kalmunai Municipal Council, Sainthamaruthu Divisional Secretariat, and Sammanthurai Pradeshiya Sabha are providing their fullest support to carry out this project, utilising their heavy vehicles, machinery, and other equipment. The villagers of Sainthamaruthu have been undergoing untold hardship during the rainy season as aquatic plants and solid waste prevent the smooth flow of water to the sea. As a result, the entire village of Sainthamaruthu is flooded. The Thona (estuary) has been facing significant challenges as a result. Deputy Director of Disaster Management, M.C.M. Riyas, announced that strict action will be taken against those who throw solid waste and those who pollute the environment. He also emphasised that unauthorised structures and encroachment will not be allowed in the future. By M.A.P. Deen – Ampara Popular

title: SLMMF workshopin Mawanella tomorrow
author: Author not found
Content: The 74th media workshop of the Sri Lanka Muslim Media Forum (SLMMF) titled ‘Media in the 21st century’ is scheduled for tomorrow (29) at Baduriya Central College in Mawanella. The workshop will be chaired by SLMMF President, Al-haj N. M. Ameen, and Principal of the school, A. L. A. Rahaman. The workshop has been organised by the Past Pupils’ Association of Mawanella Baduriya Central College. Dr. M. C. Rasmin, Thaha Muzammil, Javed Munawwar, and Ashraff A. Samad will be the resource persons. Chief Guest will be the High Commissioner of Bangladesh in Sri Lanka Tharique Mohammed Ariful Islam, who will also award certificates to the participants. Additionally, the Guest of Honour will be the former Head of Islamic Studies Department at the University of Peradeniya, M. I. M. Ameen. In attendance will be teachers who teach media subjects in schools and SLMMF Kegalle District Organiser, Ameer Hussain. Expected participants also include the Forum’s Vice President, M. A. M. Nilam, Treasurer, M. M. Jesmin, and former Media Coordinator Adhil Ali Sabry. During the workshop, a cultural item will be staged by the ‘Sanjaram’ team of the Sri Lanka Broadcasting Corporation (SLBC). By Naalir Jamaldeen

title: Sak Surin to get welcoming ceremony
author: Author not found
Content: The Thai Ministry of Natural Resources and Environment will hold a Bai Sri Su Khwan welcoming ceremony for Thai elephant Sak Surin after his 30-day quarantine ends, Thai Minister of Natural Resources and Environment Varawut Silpa-archa said. According to Varawut, the ceremony will be held at the Thai Elephant Conservation Centre (TECC) in Lampang, where the 30-year-old elephant has been treated since being flown home from Sri Lanka on 2 July. The ceremony will be held once the elephant has undergone a blood test and is given a clean bill of health. The TECC will allow the public to meet Sak Surin after the ceremony. The elephant will live with other elephants at the centre pending his full recovery, said Varawut. Sak Surin was one of three Thai elephants gifted to Sri Lanka in 2001 as goodwill ambassadors. He changed hands many times before ending up at the Kande Viharaya temple in Aluthgama, in South Sri Lanka, where he carried holy relics during annual Buddhist parades. The tusker was allegedly abused and neglected before being taken to the National Zoological Gardens last November, according to Rally for Animal Rights and Environment (RARE), a Sri Lanka-based animal organisation.(Bangkok Post)

title: Plan to restrict school uniforms to ‘Aswesuma’ beneficiaries
author: Author not found
Content: The Ceylon Teachers’ Union (CTU) accused the Government of attempting to restrict the provision of school uniforms to the ‘Aswesuma’ beneficiaries. CTU General Secretary Joseph Stalin said there is a plan to launch this programme by crediting money to the uniform account instead of providing uniform material. The purpose of this is to reduce the number of uniforms that have been provided free of charge to 430,000 schoolchildren so far. He emphasised that free uniforms and textbooks are the main reasons why children come to school. He also pointed out that a significant number of schoolchildren have stopped attending school due to the suspension of the lunch programme. Stalin queried whether the Government is attempting to limit education to a privileged few through such relief reductions, especially considering the increasing number of parents living in poor conditions. He further said, “Rulers always say that the best things are for the children. Yet, what we are presently receiving is also going to be cut. The number of underprivileged parents has increased, which in turn has led to an increase in child malnutrition. The main reason children come to school is the provision of free uniforms and textbooks. In the past, free shoes were given to selected schools. How can we expect children to come to school when all these benefits are systematically reduced? Is education only for a certain class?” Stalin also highlighted that the recent parliamentary committee report on the education system shows there are disparities in resource allocation. “There are over 3,000 schools with less than 100 students, and these poor children are the hardest hit. Sending a child to school costs at least Rs 300 a day, which is a great expense for parents. According to the Department of Census and Statistics, the cost of education often competes with the cost of food for parents. Thus, providing uniforms is a source of strength for parents,” he added. Stalin stressed that child malnutrition will likely lead to a decrease in intellectuals in the future. He highlighted that education is an investment for the country and the same holds true for free textbooks and uniforms. By Nabiya Vaffoor

title: Rs 210M in narcotics seized
author: Author not found
Content: The Police Narcotic Bureau (PNB) made significant drug seizures both at the Bandaranaike International Airport (BIA), Katunayake and in Colombo. A consignment containing 33 kg of synthetic cannabis and Amphetamine was intercepted by the authorities. The synthetic cannabis, concealed in a parcel, had been airfreighted from Hong Kong to Colombo via Dubai. Acting on a tip-off, investigators opened the package in the presence of three individuals who had come to collect it at the airport. The intoxicant was found in a processed powder form. The three men present at the airport were taken into custody and they provided crucial information that led to the discovery of an additional 100 kg of Amphetamine in a shop located in Pettah, Colombo. The total value of the confiscated contraband was estimated to be approximately Rs 210 million. In a subsequent raid conducted in the Battaramulla four more individuals, including a Russian national, were arrested for their involvement in the drug trafficking operation. The three suspects apprehended at the airport will be produced before the Negombo Magistrate, while the other four will face the Colombo Fort Magistrate. As part of the ongoing investigation, the suspects will be detained for further questioning on a Court order. BY T.K.G. Kapila  – Katunayake
