title: President opens Ratnapura Court Complex
author: Author not found
Content: The Ratnapura Court Complex, built at a cost of Rs 1,500 million, was inaugurated on the afternoon of 11 July by President Ranil Wickremesinghe, at the invitation of Minister of Justice, Prison Affairs and Constitutional Reforms, Dr. Wijeyadasa Rajapakshe. The construction of this court complex began on 10 September 2018, following a Cabinet decision made by President Ranil Wickremesinghe during his tenure as Prime Minister. Its purpose is to provide the people of Ratnapura District with a centralised location for their court-related matters. Despite the challenging economic situation, the construction of this new court complex was completed by minimising non-essential expenses and focusing solely on essential elements. This four-storey building complex is fully equipped with all the necessary facilities for a judicial centre. It includes two High Courts, a Civil Appellate High Court, two District Courts, two Magistrate’s Courts, a Legal Aid Centre, and a Community Corrections Office. President Wickremesinghe inaugurated the court complex by unveiling the memorial plaque.

title: Tea prices down in dollar, rupee terms in June
author: Author not found
Content: “National Tea Sales Average Prices”  (NTSAPs) at the Colombo Auctions last month (June) declined sharply by 7.16 per cent (US Cents (USC) 25) to USD 3.24 a kilo, year-on-year (YoY), Forbes and Walker Tea Brokers in a statement on Thursday (6 July). In rupee terms too, the decline was sharp, falling by 1.75 per cent (Rs 270.86) to Rs 974.36 a kilo. Meanwhile, NTSAPs in the first six months of the year gained by 1.92 per cent (USC 7) to USD 3.71 a kg, while its gain in rupee terms was much sharper, by 19.17 per cent (Rs 197.26) to Rs 1,226.08 a kg., Forbes data further showed. When analyzing the correlation between US dollar and rupee prices,  records showed that the rupee (‘spot’) YoY to June 30 2023 has had appreciated by between 14.72 and 15.38 per cent(Rs 53 and Rs 56) to Rs 307/308 per US dollar in two way quotes. A ‘strong’ ‘spot’ means that an exporter gets fewer rupees for his dollar earnings, while the reverse is true in the case of a weak ‘spot,’ where an exporter will get more rupees for his dollars.  However, a strong ‘spot’ favours importers because that means he would be able to import goods by spending a fewer rupees to purchase his dollars to make such imports and under perfect circumstances passing on the benefits of such low  import values to the consumer as well.  As Sri Lanka is an import driven economy, a strong ‘spot’ helps to drive down demand-pull inflationary pressure. On the other hand a strong ‘spot rupee’ may make it difficult for exporters to be competitive in the global market, particularly so if its competitors operate in economies where their domestic currencies  are relatively weak vis-à-vis the dollar. Tea was Sri Lanka’s fourth largest foreign exchange earner last year, behind garments, remittances and IT and IT Enabled Exports in that descending order, latest Central Bank of Sri Lanka and Export Development Board data showed. By Paneetha Ameresekere

title: Ports Ministry says Harin’s statement ‘NOT TRUE’
author: By Sulochana Ramiah Mohan
Content: The Ministry of Ports, Shipping and Aviation has categorically stated that there is no truth to the claims made by Minister of Tourism Harin Fernando, during the Mumbai tourism roadshow, that an Indian investor might take control of the three main airports in Sri Lanka, including the BIA. The Tourism Minister, speaking at the Outbound Travel Mart (OTM), India’s leading and only travel show focused on outbound travel, said, “I will break the news that Indian companies are taking our three airports which is going to be a phenomenal decision to really help us. The fuel tanks are taken by the Indian companies, the solar power projects are also taken by the Indians.” Further, the Minister of Tourism also told a Hindu Businessline journalist and the Hindustan Times, Pune News and many other Indian media outlets that were present at the roadshow that discussions are underway between the two sides, potentially involving management contracts. The newspaper quoted Minister Fernando as stating that the Adani Group is in negotiations with Sri Lankan authorities to manage three airports in the island nation, including the BIA. He mentioned plans to collaborate with the Adani Group for airport management, as reported by Businessline on the sidelines of the OTM show in Mumbai. Sources informed Ceylon Today that Minister Fernando has been requested to provide clarification on the matter, as the Sri Lankan Government has no plans to allocate shares to any foreign investors for the BIA or the Ratmalana International Airport. The only finalised agreement concerns the sale of the Mattala Airport to a Russo-Indian joint venture. According to the Aviation Ministry, the statement made by Minister Fernando during the Mumbai roadshow regarding the transfer of the three airports to an Indian investor was misleading information. The Government has clarified that there are no such plans in place for such a transfer. Additionally, the State-Owned Enterprise Restructuring Unit has stated that they have no knowledge of the developments regarding the airport proposals. Ceylon Today has previously reported that the Mattala Airport will be managed by Russia’s Airports of Regions Management Company (AR), in collaboration with an Indian firm, as a joint venture. Sources indicate that the Indian company involved in this venture is likely to be the Adani Group. Secretary of Sri Lanka’s Ministry of Ministry of Ports, Shipping and Aviation K.D.S. Ruwanchandra, however, told Ceylon Today that discussions have led to an agreement to transfer the operations of MRIA to a private joint venture and it is being finalised, but the Secretary did not disclose the names of the investors.

title: Shipbuilding training for youth
author: Author not found
Content: Minister of Ports, Shipping and Aviation emphasised the Colombo Dockyard PLC is the best facility for the training of university students specialising in shipbuilding industry. The Minster expressed these ideas attending a special inspection tour there. Currently, 20 undergraduate students pursuing the BSc Eng Hons Programme with a specialisation in Marine Engineering and Naval Architecture (MENA) at the University of Ruhuna have been provided with the opportunity to undergo a six-month training at Colombo Dockyard PLC. This is the first degree programme of its kind offered by a State university in Sri Lanka. The Minister further highlighted that the Colombo Dockyard PLC, renowned for its utilisation of cutting-edge technology, serves an important institution with potential for expansion as a training facility. “This expansion could be facilitated through the allocation of space under the Port of Trincomalee Development Project,” he said. The Minister urged the institution’s Management to provide extensive support to local students, enabling them to enhance their industrial potential in the shipbuilding industry. In response, the Colombo Dockyard Management stated that they would soon offer training opportunities for local students in afloat repairs at the Port of Trincomalee. During a video presentation, Colombo Dockyard PLC revealed that they have successfully constructed and delivered 236 vessels of various types to multiple European and Asian countries, as per their request. Currently, the institution employs a workforce of approximately 3,000 individuals. At the visit, the Minister also inspected the two vessels, ‘Sophia Germain’ and ‘Misje Viola’ being constructed at the Colombo Dockyard PLC. Secretary to the Ministry of Ports, Shipping and Aviation – K.D.S. Ruwanchandra, the Chairman of the Colombo Dockyard PLC – Hideaki Tanaka and several officials also attended the occasion.

title: Occidental Eden Beruwala elevates Sri Lanka’s coastal resort scene
author: Author not found
Content: Occidental Eden Beruwala is the latest addition to the Barceló Hotel Group portfolio in Sri Lanka. formerly known as Eden Resort and Spa, Beruwala, Occidental Eden Beruwala is owned by Browns Investments, and managed by the world-renowned Barceló Hotel Group under their Occidental brand. Occidental Eden Beruwala reopened its doors in May 2023 following the conclusion of an extensive renovation involving a total revamp of all 158 guest rooms, common spaces and guest amenities at a cost of Rs 1.5 billion. Located along the pristine sun-kissed beaches of Sri Lanka’s southwestern coast on a stretch known as the ‘Golden Mile’ in Beruwala, Occidental Eden Beruwala was redesigned to modern comfort and luxury, bearing in mind the evolving needs of the discerning traveller. The new unique design features of the Occidental Eden Beruwala are inspired by the art, culture and wonderful landscapes of Sri Lanka, while the resort-style ambiance creates an idyllic backdrop for a truly unforgettable island holiday. Occidental Eden Beruwala is the second hotel managed by Barceló Hotel Group in Sri Lanka, following the opening of Occidental Paradise Dambulla in 2021, a 4-star, 67-room hotel located in the cultural hub of Dambulla. The management of both hotels in Sri Lanka is the result of an agreement signed by Barceló Hotel Group in 2019 with Browns Investments, a subsidiary of the LOLC Group. This agreement also includes the management of two newly built hotels in the Maldives: a spectacular 100-villa resort located on the island of Bodufinolhu, set to open in August 2023, and an urban hotel in Malé, the country’s capital, scheduled to be opened in 2024. In addition, the agreement includes the future development of a complex of three 5-star hotels in North Malé Atoll, also in the Maldives. Speaking at the official relaunch of Occidental Eden Beruwala, Suresh Athukorala – Cluster General Manager of Occidental Hotels in Sri Lanka said, “We have embarked on a substantial investment to elevate the standards of our facilities at Occidental Eden Beruwala. As we set our sights on the future, we are thrilled to embrace the promising prospects of Sri Lanka’s tourism sector, with projections indicating a steady rise in traveller arrivals over the next 12 to 18 months. With our upgraded amenities and dedicated staff, we invite guests to immerse themselves in unparalleled hospitality Eden has to offer. Also speaking at the occasion Adrian Jansz – Director Sales and Marketing – Occidental Hotels in Sri Lanka said, “The relaunch of Occidental Eden Beruwala exemplifies Barceló Hotel Group’s unwavering commitment to continuous innovation. With this endeavour, we aim to not only elevate the standards of hospitality, but also position Sri Lanka as a leading global destination. The partnership with Browns Investments as the property owner, has further strengthened our ability to deliver seamless management and exceptional hosting, ensuring a smooth and flawless guest experience. Together, we embark on a remarkable journey of excellence. Our goal is to attract discerning travellers from the mid-upper market segment, offering them an extraordinary experience to cherish”. Meanwhile, commenting on the tie-up with Browns Investments, David Fernandez, Area Manager Asia, Barceló Hotel Group said, “Barceló Group is delighted to solidify its partnership with Browns Investments and is eagerly anticipating an exhilarating new chapter with the Occidental Eden Beruwala. As we move forward, Barceló Hotel Group remains dedicated to expanding its presence in Sri Lanka and the Maldives, recognising the immense potential and opportunities these destinations offer. Together with Browns Investments, we embark on an exciting voyage of growth, innovation, and experiences.” In keeping with Barceló Hotel Group’s world-class approach to hospitality, Occidental Eden Beruwala has been designed to offer a truly unforgettable island holiday for a diverse range of travellers. From the newly renovated All Day Dining restaurant, à la carte restaurant, pool bar and a newly created sports bar, to the magnificent swimming pool and extensive gardens, all have been carefully curated to showcase a resort-style ambiance that will create the backdrop for a truly unforgettable travel experience. The Balinese Spa presents a holistic approach for wellness enthusiasts, while the meeting and banqueting venues along with the beautifully landscaped outdoor spaces of the Occidental Eden Beruwala are ideal for MICE tourism. The establishment comprises various amenities designed to cater to different age groups. For the younger ones, there’s the vibrant and engaging ‘Barcy Club‘, where children can explore their creativity and have endless fun under the supervision of trained staff. Teenagers can enjoy the exclusive ‘ONE’ Teen Club, a dedicated space where they can socialise, participate in exciting activities, and make lifelong memories. Additionally, the hotel provides a plethora of indoor and outdoor recreation activities, ensuring that guests of all ages can indulge in their preferred pastimes. Barceló Hotel Group, the hotel division of the Barceló Group, is the second largest hotel chain in Spain and is among the top 30 largest in the world, in number of rooms. The group currently operate more than 280, 4 and 5-star urban and holiday hotels, totalling more than 62,000 rooms across 25 countries and marketed under four brands: Royal Hideaway Luxury Hotels & Resorts, Barceló Hotels & Resorts, Occidental Hotels & Resorts and Allegro Hotels. It is also part of the Crestline Hotels & Resorts group, an independent hotel company with 130 establishments. For more information, please visit: www.barcelo.com

title: Two ‘substandard’ anaesthetics removed from use– Dr. Ratnayake
author: Author not found
Content: Additional Secretary of the Health Ministry, Dr. Saman Ratnayake said measures had been taken to remove from use the two anaesthetic drugs that had allegedly led to the deaths of three persons and caused severe controversy regarding the quality of medicinal drugs being used in the State health service. Dr. Ratnayake said yesterday (12) that the batches of the two anaesthetic drugs which had allegedly led to the deaths had been removed from use while their samples had been sent for testing to the laboratory facility of the National Medicines Regulatory Authority (NMRA). However, Dr. Ratnayake reassured patients that steps had been taken to import an alternative drug for anaesthesia. He said alternative anaesthetics were scheduled to arrive in the country today (13).

title: Japan hands over DTTB tech report to SL
author: Author not found
Content: Japanese Ambassador Mizukoshi Hideaki handed over the technical standards prepared by Japan on the Digital Terrestrial Television Broadcasting (DTTB) Project in Sri Lanka to Minister of Mass Media Bandula Gunawardana yesterday (12). Japan has been continuously supporting the DTTB Project in Sri Lanka since 2014 with Japanese Official Development Assistance (ODA) financing. The launch of the DTTB Project in Sri Lanka was held in 2021.  Japan said, the DTTB Project will offer two major benefits to Sri Lanka providing High-Definition television broadcasts free of charge that will strengthen the telecommunications infrastructure that serves as the foundation for the digitalisation of social and economic activities through the effective use of the radio waves. Ambassador Hideaki stressed how significant this project is in terms of implementing the ‘Digital Economy’ that the Government of Sri Lanka has been focusing on as one of its top priorities, as well as exploring bilateral cooperation in this field. It is sincerely hoped that this milestone project will be successfully completed soon to help achieve the sustainable development of Sri Lanka as well as to further develop bilateral relations between Japan and Sri Lanka, the Japanese Ambassador said. Japan announced it would support DTTB several years ago and finally a technical report has been prepared to boost the project. In Analog TV broadcasting, Japan supported the setting up of the Sri Lanka Rupavahini Corporation (SLRC) which started its TV broadcasting in 1982, and since then, Japan has been continuously providing technical cooperation to SLRC. Japan said, now it is time for Sri Lanka to move to the digitalisation of TV broadcasting through the DTTB Project. By Sulochana Ramiah Mohan

title: CID probes six Onmax DT directors
author: Author not found
Content: The CID yesterday (12) informed the Colombo Chief Magistrate that they are presently probing the accounts of six officials from the Director Board of Onmax DT after they had allegedly withdrawn a sum of Rs 790 million and had deposited it into their accounts. The CID prosecuting told Court that the six suspects had withdrawn the aforesaid sum which had been maintained as a pyramid system surreptitiously and that they will produce further submissions following investigations. The Court had instructed the CEO of the Binance.Com firm of the US to suspend eight of the accounts maintained under the pyramid system at the financial institution Onmax DT on 20 April. The CBSL urged the Attorney General on 1 June to criminally prosecute eight financial institutions that had been operating flouting the Bank Act. Having considered the submissions, 57 bank accounts of Onmax DT were ordered to frozen by the Court previously and the Court also ordered to impound the passports of a few of its officers.  By Kumudu Upul Shantha

title: Special majority needed to reconvene LG bodies – AG
author: Author not found
Content: Chief Opposition Whip Lakshman Kiriella yesterday (12) urged the Government to state whether it is planning to hold a referendum or not as the Attorney General has informed that the controversial Private Members Bill to re-convene local government bodies requires a special majority or a referendum. The AG, in a letter addressed to the Secretary-General of Parliament, had informed he is of the opinion that clause 2 of the legislation is inconsistent with Articles 3, 4, 12(1) and 14(1) of the Constitution and that it has to be enacted with a special majority and through a referendum. “Further, a dissolved local authority may be re-convened for an indefinite period of time without any nexus to the crisis referred to in the proposed provision. Therefore, the proposed amendment would have the effect of extending the terms of local authorities and delaying elections, and members of local authorities who have exceeded their term limit as elected representatives of the people could continue in office for an indefinite period of time without a democratically obtained mandate. Hence, the franchise of people, as well as their fundamental rights to vote and stand for elections would be affected. In this context, your attention is drawn to the special determination of the Supreme Court in SC (SD) Nos 20-32/2017 to the 20th Amendment to the Constitution Bill,” the AG said in his letter. The amendments to the Pradeshiya Sabha Ordinance, Municipal Council Ordinance and Urban Council Ordinance to reinstate local government members and re-convene dissolved bodies were presented to Parliament about a fortnight ago. (GW)

title: No malaria cases detected at Teaching Hospital Jaffna
author: Author not found
Content: In reference to the article titled, ‘Jaffna residents facing malaria risk,’ that appeared in the 5 July 2023 edition of Ceylon Today, Teaching Hospital Jaffna strongly denied the claim that a malaria case was detected at the hospital. Director of the Teaching Hospital, Dr. T. Sathiyamoorthy, in a letter, noted that the news item had appeared without any communication with him. “No malaria case was detected at the Teaching Hospital this year,” he said. He also said, his hospital did not have an ‘Epidemic Unit’ as had been mentioned in the news article. “Hence, the false news should be investigated to avoid misleading the public,” he added.

title: 99 Regional-level Working Committees set up
author: Author not found
Content: Former Tourism Minister Achala Jagoda said, on Tuesday (11), that targeting the UNP National Conference a total of 99 regional-level Working Committees have been formed islandwide including in the North and East. Jagoda also claimed that the credit for transforming this country economically and educationally must go to the UNP. During the present economic and political crisis many who are well-versed in politics were demanding a new political equation, according to Jagoda. He said the country’s development and the UNP are interconnected and inseparable. “When the UNP rears its head, the country’s economy will also start to bloom,” he added. “At a time when normalcy is being restored, a programme to revamp the UNP and make it a victorious force in the country once again is underway including in the North and South,” Jagoda said. He said, serious allegations were levelled against the UNP in the past with regard to the Rs 10 billion Treasury Bond Scam, adding that even in that circumstance President Ranil Wickremesinghe acted prudently and carried out a Rs 12 billion transaction, according to Jagoda. Jagoda also claimed that no destruction had been caused to the financial system or currency reserves during the tenure of Governments led by the UNP. “As the taxes were withdrawn during the previous Government it had exerted negative impacts on the economy and its income sources. Citizens lost Rs 600 billion in tax income,” Jagoda said. “The UNP has never done any financial harm to the country. Those who committed this wrong were continually blaming the UNP. The ‘Aswesuma’ welfare programme introduced targeting the people in the marginal setting and those who are underprivileged has turned into a topic of debate islandwide,” Jagoda added. By Naalir Jamaldeen

He said the country’s development and the UNP are interconnected and inseparable. “When the UNP rears its head, the country’s economy will also start to bloom,” he added. “At a time when normalcy is being restored, a programme to revamp the UNP and make it a victorious force in the country once again is underway including in the North and South,” Jagoda said. He said, serious allegations were levelled against the UNP in the past with regard to the Rs 10 billion Treasury Bond Scam, adding that even in that circumstance President Ranil Wickremesinghe acted prudently and carried out a Rs 12 billion transaction, according to Jagoda. Jagoda also claimed that no destruction had been caused to the financial system or currency reserves during the tenure of Governments led by the UNP. “As the taxes were withdrawn during the previous Government it had exerted negative impacts on the economy and its income sources. Citizens lost Rs 600 billion in tax income,” Jagoda said. “The UNP has never done any financial harm to the country. Those who committed this wrong were continually blaming the UNP. The ‘Aswesuma’ welfare programme introduced targeting the people in the marginal setting and those who are underprivileged has turned into a topic of debate islandwide,” Jagoda added. By Naalir Jamaldeen

title: CAASL to host Sri Lanka Aviation Day in collaboration with IATA
author: Author not found
Content: The Civil Aviation Authority of Sri Lanka (CAASL) is all set to conduct a knowledge-sharing event for the aviation industry of Sri Lanka titled ‘Sri Lanka Aviation Day’ in collaboration with the International Air Transport Association (IATA) on 14 July at the Auditorium of the Civil Aviation Authority of Sri Lanka. The aviation industry has faced unprecedented challenges in the recent past with the Covid-19 pandemic leading to a dramatic decline in air travel worldwide. However, as countries begin to emerge from the pandemic there is renewed optimism and a collective effort to rebuild and grow the aviation industry. CAASL said having that in mind, they will present ‘Sri Lanka Aviation Day’, aimed at rebuilding the skies to position our aviation sector for growth. The event provides a unique platform for industry leaders, policymakers, and stakeholders to come together, explore challenges, and identify opportunities for recovery and sustainable growth in the industry. Through a series of panel discussions, keynote speeches, case studies, and networking events, participants will delve into crucial topics that are pivotal to the industry’s resurgence. Sri Lanka Aviation Day is an exceptional opportunity for industry leaders, policymakers, and stakeholders to come together, share insights, and develop strategies to rebuild and strengthen the aviation industry in Sri Lanka. We are grateful for the support of our esteemed partner, IATA, whose expertise and insights will ensure the event’s relevance and impact.

title: No malaria cases detected at Teaching Hospital Jaffna
author: Author not found
Content: In reference to the article titled, ‘Jaffna residents facing malaria risk,’ that appeared in the 5 July 2023 edition of Ceylon Today, Teaching Hospital Jaffna strongly denied the claim that a malaria case was detected at the hospital. Director of the Teaching Hospital, Dr. T. Sathiyamoorthy, in a letter, noted that the news item had appeared without any communication with him. “No malaria case was detected at the Teaching Hospital this year,” he said. He also said, his hospital did not have an ‘Epidemic Unit’ as had been mentioned in the news article. “Hence, the false news should be investigated to avoid misleading the public,” he added.

title: Primary investment minimum USD 100M per land plot
author: Author not found
Content: The Colombo Port City investment regulations that were gazetted on 7 July, under the Colombo Port City Economic Commission Act, No. 11 of 2021, cite that under several criteria that are designated as a Primary Business of Strategic Importance (BSI) of the Port City an investor can make an investment of a minimum of USD 100,000,000 (one hundred million) per plot of land or a prorated investment in a subdivided plot of land according to the Colombo Port City (Development Control) Regulations. The other choice is to make an investment of a minimum of USD 25,000,000 (twenty five million) in the plots of land for the Marina of Social Infrastructure. The regulations also say that a primary BSI shall make a choice out of the two exemption or incentive schemes specified in items such as global and regional economic activity in international trade and shipping logistic operations of the sub-regulation should inform such choice to the Port City Commission. Such a choice once made would be final and will not be changed. The business activities referred to in sub-regulation are: (a) global and regional economic activity in international trade, shipping logistic operations; (b) offshore banking and finance; (c) information technology; (d) business process outsourcing; (e) corporate headquarters operations; (f) regional distribution operations; (g) tourism and other ancillary services; (h) innovation; (i) entrepreneurship; (j) entertainment; (k) generation of employment opportunities; (l) sustainable development; or (m) urban amenity operations in the settlement of a residential community. At the same time, the criteria referred to in sub-regulations are: (a) the authorised person or its parent company shall have an annual global revenue of more than USD 50,000,000 (fifty million); (b) a minimum of one hundred employees shall be employed within the Area of Authority of the Colombo Port City within five years from the commencement of operations; (c) the authorised person shall be a start-up or growth stage business, with an enterprise valuation of at least USD 500, 000 within five years from the date of granting a licence to the authorised person under the Act; or (d) the authorised person demonstrates to the satisfaction of the Commission that the business will contribute to the economy and social development in Sri Lanka, by fostering innovation, knowledge transfer, technology transfer, research and development, or generate the impetus for creating an international financial centre within the Area of Authority of the Colombo Port City. The businesses designated as Secondary BSI are entitled to exemptions from or incentives under, the enactments set out in Schedule II to the Act, for a period of twenty-five years from the date of publication of an Order in the Gazette in terms of subsection (3) of Section 53 of the Act. To be entitled to the exemptions or incentives granted under these regulations, an authorised person shall be designated as a Primary Businesses of Strategic Importance or Secondary Businesses of Strategic Importance within two years from the date of publication of the regulations in the Gazette. By Sulochana Ramiah Mohan

title: Adopt healthy lifestyle to ward off cancer, diabetes
author: Author not found
Content: Consultant Paediatrician, Dr. Deepal Perera appealed to children and parents to change their style of living before cancer and diabetes claim them. Addressing the media, Dr. Perera lamented yesterday that at least 900 million children were diagnosed with cancer and another 100 with diabetes annually. “If we consider the child population up to 19 years, many of them are vulnerable to these two deadly diseases,” he lamented, noting that this had not been the case 10 to 15 years earlier. “However, this situation has occurred due to multi-factorial reasons,” he said, urging parents and children to refrain from consuming fast food and food with high levels of sugar and fat. Nowadays, children don’t like to go out of their homes but prefer to remain in their rooms playing games or scrolling on mobile phones. “A majority of youngsters do not go outside, but prefer to remain in their rooms as they are addicted to the mobile phone,” he lamented. The LRH Paediatrician urged parents and children to mend their ways by engaging in healthy food habits and outdoor activities. “Parents should make it a point to provide their children with natural wholesome food instead of fast food while ensuring they get the required physical exercise,” he noted, warning that should the situation continue the country would be faced with having to bear the burden of a sickly younger generation.  By Dilanthi Jayamanne

title: Sirisena wants compensation deadline extended
author: Author not found
Content: Former President Maithripala Sirisena has requested an extension period to settle the remaining sum of Rs 85 million as compensation to the victims of the Easter Sunday attacks.  Sirisena filed a motion in the Supreme Court stating that he has already settled Rs 15 million to the Office for Reparations bowing to the judgment of the Supreme Court on 12 January 2022. He further said he would settle the remaining sum of Rs 85 million in ten equal instalments of Rs 8,500,000 annually starting from 30 June 2024 and ending on 30 June 2033 as his monthly income except for the minster allowances, the pension as a former president is Rs 97,500 and Rs 54,285 as a minister. The Supreme Court had also ordered former IGP Pujith Jayasundara and former Head of State Intelligence SDIG Nilantha Jayawardena to pay a sum of Rs 75 million each, former Defence Secretary, Hemasiri Fernando, to pay a sum of Rs 50 million and former Chief of National Intelligence Sisira Mendis to pay a sum of Rs 10 million as compensation to the victims of the Easter Sunday attacks. Court held that the respondents failed to prevent the Easter Sunday attacks in 2019 despite having received prior intelligence and had violated fundamental rights enshrined under Article 12(1) and 14(1)(e) of the Constitution. The order was made when 12 petitions, filed against those accountable for the Easter Sunday attacks, were taken up before a Supreme Court Bench including Chief Justice Jayantha Jayasuriya and Justices Buwaneka Aluwihare, L.T.B. Dehideniya, Murdu N.B. Fernando, S. Thurairaja, A.H.M.D. Nawaz and A.L. Shiran Gooneratne.

title: Population, housing census soon
author: Author not found
Content: A Gazette Notification has been issued by President Ranil Wickremesinghe ordering to conduct a population and housing census for the years 2023-2024. This was ordered by President Wickremesinghe in his capacity as the Minister of Finance, Economic Stabilization, and National Policies. The 15th Population and Housing Census of the country was scheduled to be held in 2021 but was postponed due to the Covid-19 pandemic. A population and housing census is to be conducted again for the years 2023-2024. The first population and housing census in Sri Lanka was conducted in 1871 and the last population and housing census was conducted in 2012.

title: A/L exam from 27 Nov to 21 Dec – Susil
author: Author not found
Content: The 2023 G.C.E Advanced Level examination is scheduled to be held from 27 November to 21 December, Education Minister Susil Premajayantha announced yesterday (11). Minister Premajayantha also said the evaluation of answer scripts of the 2022 A/L exam will be completed by mid-August, and thus, the results are likely to be released before the end of the month. Premajayantha assured that all relevant authorities plan to complete the examination before this Christmas.

title: French Naval Ship Lorraine arrives in Colombo
author: Author not found
Content: The French Naval Ship Lorraine arrived at the Port of Colombo on a formal visit last morning (11). The ship was welcomed by the Sri Lanka Navy in accordance with naval traditions. The 142.20 m ship is an Air-Defence Multipurpose Frigate manned by 154 crew members and is commanded by Captain Xavier Bagot. Meanwhile, the Commanding Officer of the ship called on Commander Western Naval Area, Rear Admiral Suresh De Silva at the Western Naval Command Headquarters yesterday (11). During their stay in Sri Lanka, the crew members of the ship are expected to visit some of the tourist attractions in the country. Lorraine is scheduled to leave the island on 15 July and she will conduct a Passage Exercise (PASSEX) with a ship of the Sri Lanka Navy off Colombo on her departure.

title: Cabinet greenlights India-SL joint declaration
author: Author not found
Content: The Cabinet of Ministers has granted approval for the combined proposal to sign a joint declaration of intent between the Government of India and the Government of Sri Lanka, to work together to achieve the goals of improving the quality of dairy products in Sri Lanka. Cabinet Spokesman Bandula Gunawardana, addressing the Cabinet media briefing yesterday (11), said the programme will assist in making the country self-sufficient in milk production and increasing the income of small-scale dairy farmers. Meanwhile, the Attorney General’s clearance has been received for the Joint Declaration of Intent (JDOI) that has been drafted for this purpose. Accordingly, Cabinet approved the combined proposal presented by the President and the Minister of Agriculture to sign the said JDOI.

title: Ports Ministry says Harin’s statement ‘NOT TRUE’
author: By Sulochana Ramiah Mohan
Content: The Ministry of Ports, Shipping and Aviation has categorically stated that there is no truth to the claims made by Minister of Tourism Harin Fernando, during the Mumbai tourism roadshow, that an Indian investor might take control of the three main airports in Sri Lanka, including the BIA. The Tourism Minister, speaking at the Outbound Travel Mart (OTM), India’s leading and only travel show focused on outbound travel, said, “I will break the news that Indian companies are taking our three airports which is going to be a phenomenal decision to really help us. The fuel tanks are taken by the Indian companies, the solar power projects are also taken by the Indians.” Further, the Minister of Tourism also told a Hindu Businessline journalist and the Hindustan Times, Pune News and many other Indian media outlets that were present at the roadshow that discussions are underway between the two sides, potentially involving management contracts. The newspaper quoted Minister Fernando as stating that the Adani Group is in negotiations with Sri Lankan authorities to manage three airports in the island nation, including the BIA. He mentioned plans to collaborate with the Adani Group for airport management, as reported by Businessline on the sidelines of the OTM show in Mumbai. Sources informed Ceylon Today that Minister Fernando has been requested to provide clarification on the matter, as the Sri Lankan Government has no plans to allocate shares to any foreign investors for the BIA or the Ratmalana International Airport. The only finalised agreement concerns the sale of the Mattala Airport to a Russo-Indian joint venture. According to the Aviation Ministry, the statement made by Minister Fernando during the Mumbai roadshow regarding the transfer of the three airports to an Indian investor was misleading information. The Government has clarified that there are no such plans in place for such a transfer. Additionally, the State-Owned Enterprise Restructuring Unit has stated that they have no knowledge of the developments regarding the airport proposals. Ceylon Today has previously reported that the Mattala Airport will be managed by Russia’s Airports of Regions Management Company (AR), in collaboration with an Indian firm, as a joint venture. Sources indicate that the Indian company involved in this venture is likely to be the Adani Group. Secretary of Sri Lanka’s Ministry of Ministry of Ports, Shipping and Aviation K.D.S. Ruwanchandra, however, told Ceylon Today that discussions have led to an agreement to transfer the operations of MRIA to a private joint venture and it is being finalised, but the Secretary did not disclose the names of the investors.

title: Monk Discourse Bill to Parliament in two months
author: Author not found
Content: Cabinet has decided to adopt a draft bill immediately on monks’ discourses to deal with disciplinary matters and acts against the Buddhasasana. Addressing the Cabinet media briefing yesterday (11), Cabinet Spokesman Bandula Gunawardana said at present, there are many cases of indiscipline and acts against the Buddhasasana regarding monks from different parts of the country and this decision has been taken as a government intervention in this regard. “The Government will take steps to strictly implement the law regarding incitement of religious hatred and other terms that attack religious sentiments and the necessary steps have been taken to present this bill on monk discourse to Parliament within the next two months,” he added. He further said the final draft of the Bill has been submitted for perusal by the prelates and after receiving the comments and suggestions of the prelates, Secretary of the Buddhasasana, Religious and Cultural Affairs Ministry Somaratne Vidanapathirana has directed to submit a Cabinet paper. By Nabiya Vaffoor

title: Controversial ‘Pandu Karanda’ tree removed
author: Author not found
Content: Cabinet approval had been granted to remove the controversial Pandu Karanda tree (Crudia Zeylanica) located in Daraluwa, Veyangoda and was at the centre of a controversy as it stood in the way of the Central Expressway project, Transport and Highways Minister Bandula Gunawardana said. Minister Gunawardana said if they were to change the route of the expressway – Kadawatha-Mirigama section, it would have cost Rs 15 billion more. He said therefore Cabinet approval was sought to remove the tree. He said they have found 12 other trees which are over 40 years old in the area. The tree was removed over the weekend despite campaigns by environmentalists earlier.

title: Dr. Perera urges to vaccinate children
author: Author not found
Content: With four confirmed cases of measles being treated at the Lady Ridgeway Hospital (LRH), Consultant Paediatrician of the Hospital, Dr. Deepal Perera urged parents to have their children vaccinated. Dr. Perera said of 12 patients admitted to the LRH with suspected measles-like symptoms four had contracted the disease by yesterday (11). However, all of them were those who had not taken the measles vaccine, he said. High fever, runny nose and teary eyes were symptoms of measles. “Perhaps some people do not realise the gravity of the disease which makes them reluctant to have their children vaccinated,” he stressed. Dr. Perera, noting the complications of measles, said it included; diarrhoea, pneumonia and subacute sclerosing panencephalitis (SSPE – a progressive neurological disorder of children and young adults). It affects the central nervous system (CNS), however, only 1 in 100,000 would suffer such complications. The LRH Paediatric Consultant urged parents not to neglect giving their toddlers the Measles, Mumps, and Rubella (MMR) vaccine on time – the first dose is administered when he or she is nine months and the booster dose at the age of three years. He noted that the vaccine provided immunity against measles, mumps and German measles. The State health service administers the vaccines free of charge.   By Dilanthi Jayamanne

title: Kwatra says visit to enhance India – SL ties
author: Author not found
Content: Indian Foreign Secretary Vinay Mohan Kwatra, who arrived on 10 July for a short work visit, with the primary focus being the forthcoming visit of President Ranil Wickremesinghe, told journalists yesterday (11) that his visit was also to ensure a positive transformation in India-Sri Lanka relations. “We also discussed the key areas of partnership that we could progress ahead of the visit, going into the visit, priorities of the Sri Lankan leadership, as also shared with this the perspective of our leadership on the relationship, the strength of the relationship, different elements of cooperation in the relationship, elements of our partnership in years ahead across the entire matrix of economic partnership that India and Sri Lanka enjoy,” he told the media at India House. “India’s objective is to ensure that the visit of the President to India is a huge success and that India had worked and cooperated very well in the last 14-16 months of various challenges that Sri Lanka went through,” he noted before he flew back to India yesterday afternoon.  Meeting the President yesterday (11) at the Ministry of Defence, the President said they   focused on enhancing bilateral relations and working towards future economic and social goals that would benefit both countries’ populations. The President further briefed on the Government’s reforms programme aimed at strengthening the country’s economy. He also acknowledged India’s continuous support as a neighbouring ally during the recent economic crisis. The Indian Foreign Secretary also held discussions with President’s Senior Adviser on National Security and Chief of Presidential Staff Sagala Ratnayaka.  During his visit, Kwatra, accompanied by his official delegation and Indian High Commissioner Gopal Bagley, also held separate meetings with Foreign Minister Ali Sabry, Foreign Secretary Aruni Wijewardane, as well as various Cabinet Ministers and other officials. President Wickremesinghe and his delegation, which includes Fisheries Minister Douglas Devananda and Minister of Water Supply and Estate Infrastructure Development Jeevan Thondaman, are scheduled to embark on their official visit to New Delhi on 21 June where they will meet Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi. By Sulochana Ramiah Mohan

title: Cabinet approves MoU with France
author: Author not found
Content: The Cabinet of Ministers approved the proposal presented by the Minister of Urban Development and Housing to sign this Memorandum of Understanding for the pilot project to monitor oil spills caused by ships. The decision was announced by Cabinet Spokesman Minister Bandula Gunawardana during the weekly Cabinet media briefing held yesterday (11). Due to the growth of the shipping industry and port development, the number of ships sailing in Sri Lankan waters is increasing. Therefore, it is recognised that it is necessary to establish a system to quickly obtain information about oil spills caused by ships. With such a system, it will be possible to take quick measures to prevent marine pollution caused by ships, identify the responsible ships and take relevant legal action. Accordingly, as a pilot project, the Ministry of Economics and Finance, France has agreed to provide a grant of Euro 601,810 through the Collected Localisation Satellites (CLS) programme. The clearance of the Attorney General has been received for the draft Memorandum of Understanding (MoU) prepared for this purpose and Cabinet approved the proposal presented by the Minister of Urban Development and Housing to sign this MoU.(NV)

title: Second stage of Deegawapiya Stupa restoration inaugurated
author: Author not found
Content: The second stage of the Deegawapiya Stupa restoration project was launched by placing a symbolic Stupa brick by Defence Secretary General (Ret) Kamal Gunaratne, at the Deegawapiya premises, on 10 July. Gen. Gunaratne, the driving force behind the entire project since its beginning, paid homage to the Chief Prelate of the Deegawapiya Raja Maha Viharaya Ven. Mahaoya Sobitha Thera on his arrival. A brief discussion on the progress of the restoration project was also held during the session. The three-day-long preparation for the second stage saw various customary rituals associated with the sacred construction including an all-night Pirith chanting that culminated in the dawn of Monday followed by an almsgiving to the Venerable Maha Sanga, at the venue. The team led by Gunaratne reviewed peripheral constructions in the site while paying close attention to the Shrine Hall and the Relic House which are being erected at a rapid pace. The whole process is funded by the ‘Deegawapiya Aruna Trust Fund’ which is generously supported by philanthropists. On completion of the programme at Deegawapiya, the delegation also delved into the progress of the ‘Neelagiri Maha Seya’ restoration project, which has reached up to 41 feet from the ground level, as of today. These Stupa restoration projects are in progress under the supervision of the Department of Archaeology and relevant State institutions while preserving ancient value and former glory of the respective sacred sites. The Venerable Maha Sanga including the Assistant Coordinating Director for Pirivena Education in Eastern Province, Ven. Kirindiwela Sri Somarathana Thera and Chief Incumbent of Pothubandana Raja Maha Viharaya Ven. Mahaoya Jinarathana Thera, Army Commander Lieutenant General Vikum Liyanage, Air Force Commander Air Marshal Udeni Rajapaksa, Additional Director General Academic and Director of Architectural Conservation of the Department of Archaeology Prasanna Ratnayake, Commander Security Forces Headquarters East Major General Darshana Wijesekara, Military Liaison Officer of the Ministry of Defence, Brigadier Dammika Welagedara, regional and respective project officers, architects, archaeologists, engineers and Police Officers were also present during the visit.

title: PM calls for speedy implementation of official language policy
author: Author not found
Content: Prime Minister Dinesh Gunawardena said the speedy implementation of the official language policy would enhance cohesion in the multi-lingual Sri Lankan society. He urged all relevant institutions and departments to take effective steps in this regard. Addressing the Symposium of National Languages Equality Advancement Project (NLEAP) in Colombo on Monday (10), he said the cohesion of any nation comprising of different communities, depends largely on the ability to communicate with each other. Language is also an inalienable right of the people. Communication rights involve freedom of opinion and expression, participation in one’s own culture, linguistic rights, rights to education, privacy and assembly, he said. “If I may recap, I’m in Galle Face Hotel today, and one year ago just outside this place at Galle Face Green, there was anarchy. Let me recall, under President Ranil Wickremesinghe, we have been able to restore law and order in the country with the support of the people. And also restore economic stability,” he said. The Prime Minister expressed gratitude to the Government of Canada for the financial support extended to the NLEAP Project and thanked High Commissioner Eric Walsh for his support to extend the project to help Sri Lanka to achieve its objective of equal advancement in national language usage. He said the objective of the Official Languages Policy of Sri Lanka is to enhance acceptance by Sri Lankan women and men of the cultural diversity in the country. “Overcoming communication barriers also help in speedy economic development and ensuring uniformity in development. That in turn helps to reduce poverty and improve economic and social equality of Sinhala and Tamil speaking women and men throughout Sri Lanka,” he said. Director of National Languages Equality Advancement Project, Michael Emblem said the NLEAP project has served as a forum for academics, students and professionals to focus on specific challenges relating to the multilingual nature of Sri Lanka and gender-based barriers and to find solutions to them. Canadian High Commissioner Eric Walsh said, Canada as a bilingual nation has shared its experiences with Sri Lanka through NLEAP project. MP Dilan Perera, Kulasingham Thilipan and Secretary to the Ministry of Public Administration and Home Affairs Ranjith Ashoka, diplomats, officials, academics and students took part in this Symposium.

title: Third International Conference on Mathematics on 14, 15 July
author: Author not found
Content: The third International Conference on Mathematics and Mathematics Education (ICMME) will take place on 14 and 15 July, at the Postgraduate Institute of Science of the University of Peradeniya. In 2019, ICMME was inaugurated following a suggestion made by the Ministry of Education in enhancing mathematical literacy in the country by providing a unique platform for Mathematics Educators, especially to expose school teachers to diverse aspects of research in mathematics. The theme of the Conference was set forth as ‘Mathematics for a Better World’ considering the significance and impact of the subject. PGIS organised the first ICMME in collaboration with the Education Ministry and the National Institute of Education (NIE). Based on its significant success, the organising committee decided to hold the conference biennially. The second ICMME was held in 2021, once more in collaboration with the Education Ministry. In addition to holding the Conference, the organising committee had also organised a series of workshops in 2021 to provide hands-on experience to school teachers on various aspects of research in Mathematics Education, and also how to use the two softwares – ‘GeoGebra’ and ‘Minitab’ – as interactive teaching aids. Marking another milestone, the third ICMME will take place on 14 and 15 July at the PGIS premises. Since last year, several pre-Conference events were organised; a workshop on the use of certain software as teaching aids, three talks by distinguished local mathematicians on effective teaching of mathematics to schoolchildren, workshops on preparing an Abstract, extended Abstract, presentation slides, and awareness sessions on the resources available at the Faculty of Science for the target audience. The inauguration ceremony of ICMME 2023 will be held with the participation of Chief Guest, Dr. Athira S. (Assistant High Commissioner of India to Sri Lanka), Prof. M.D. Lamawansa (Vice Chancellor, University of Peradeniya) and Prof. Terrence Madhujith (Deputy Vice Chancellor, University of Peradeniya). The keynote address will be delivered via Zoom by Prof. Asha Rao, Associate Dean of Mathematical Sciences at the Royal Melbourne Institute of Technology (RMIT) University in Australia. The two plenary addresses on the second day of the Conference will be delivered by Prof. Berinderjeet Kaur, Professor of Mathematics Education at the NIE and Nanyang Technological University (NTU) in Singapore, and by Prof. Dinesh Ekanayake, Professor and Graduate Coordinator in the Department of Mathematics and Philosophy at Western Illinois University. A rigorous review process which involved an initial double-blind review that took place over several weeks resulted in choosing Abstracts with significant contributions to be presented at the Conference. This review was done with the assistance of local and international subject experts. The technical sessions will be held on the second day of the Conference during which more than 60 research studies will be presented via Zoom. The participants will get the unique opportunity to receive feedback from experts in the fields of Mathematics and Mathematics Education, and also to interact with the audience and share their interests. Each research study will be published in the Proceedings of the Conference whose e-copy will be sent to the participants along with a Certificate of accomplishment. In conclusion, the organising committee of ICMME 2023 believes that the research findings and the up-to-date knowledge inculcated at the pre-Conference workshops will pave the way to enhance mathematical literacy in the country which will result in enhancing the teaching-learning process of mathematics. (The writer is a Senior Lecturer at the Department of Mathematics of the University of Peradeniya, and the Chairman of ICMME 2023) By Dr. Rajitha Ranasinghe

title: 60% shortage in daily liquid milk production – COPA
author: Author not found
Content: The Committee on Public Accounts (COPA) revealed there is a significant shortfall in the daily production of liquid milk in the country. This was disclosed during a meeting held on 6 July, chaired by State Minister Lasantha Alagiyawanna. COPA highlighted that only 40 per cent of the daily liquid milk requirement is being produced, resulting in a 60 per cent deficit. According to the officials, 15,000 farms capable of producing 100 litres of milk per day have been set up to address the shortfall in liquid milk production. By setting up these farms, the authorities are actively working to bridge the gap in liquid milk production and fulfil the daily requirements of the country. It is a significant effort to boost milk production and reduce the present shortfall. The officials pointed out that approximately 2,000 farms have already been registered for this purpose. Recognising the severity of the situation, the COPA Chairman emphasised the need for a national plan to address the shortfall in liquid milk production. Also, it was recommended that a report detailing this plan be prepared within two weeks. By Dinithi Wijesundara
